Reviews.Title: “Good stay”
Reviews.Author: Mclyn Posted by an Easytobook.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Very happy with all the hotel had to offer with a few comments Jugs used for breakfast were very heavy and could pose a problem for some. Showers quite hard to regulate. We're not told they had a function on one night and returned early t chill in bar and it was full to the brim with no alternative. Pub opposite very good with friendly staff and good food.

Reviews.Title: “Only good for singles or couples”
Reviews.Author: Travistys
Reviews.Content: Fab location and vibe, but a little too Ã¼ber cool in many respects. No instructions in room, no face washers, tissues, water. Cold flooring with no soft furnishings. Bathroom design too over cool so water spills all over the bathroom which is black and dim. But, amazingly comfy bed, great ventilation to rooms and good breakfast spread. Good bed linen and excellent free wifi. Overall great for a 1 to 2 night stay where not much time will be spent here as it is really too sparse . The downstairs area is warm and groovy with free coffee and gat mags. 6.5 out of 10.

Reviews.Title: “4 nights in Amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: Gary W Posted by an Easytobook.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Wonderful staff, very helpful and freindly. Our stay was dependant upon a fragile elevator which did not go to the 4th floor, only the 3rd. The room overlooking the main street was decorated sparcely with very poor lighting in both the bathroom and shower areas. Top floor walls sloped inwards taking away from floor area and making entry into the king sized bed a bit difficult (watch you don't bump your head on the exposed beams). In the room was an oversized leather chair and ottoman which was tucked into a corner with no lights making it somewhat dark and uncomfortable for reading. On the plus side the bed was very comfortable and the window in the room opened up outwards allowing for some evening ventilation into the room. Downstairs in the lobby is a breakfast served from 730am till 1000am every day (well worth having). Also, there is included free tea and coffee from the bar (24 hrs.). Across the street from the hotel is the Cafe Kale where we had some fantastic dinners at a reasonalble price (dining in Amsterdam can be expensive). I would recommend this hotel to my friends with words of caution as to what they may be getting for their money.

Reviews.Title: “Nice lobby! Tiny room!”
Reviews.Author: soverdi
Reviews.Content: The lobby was a great place to hang out with a fireplace in front, and free coffee and tea is offered at the bar anytime. Staff is friendly and they have free easy to access WiFi. You are given a key to lock your room and they request to leave the key with them while you're out. Now the room, it did say small. You have to walk sideways to reach other side of bed. Had to leave clothes in luggage as there are no cabinets to store them. We also had to put the hair dryer on the floor as there's no place to put it in the bath. But it seems that it's meant for tall people since I had to tiptoe to use bathroom mirror. Will probably stay here again, but get a bigger room.

Reviews.Title: “THE Premier Hotel in Amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: IsaacChame
Reviews.Content: I absolutely LOVED Hotel V â€“ I cannot overstate how amazing this hotel is. An inspired fusion of old-world hotel elegance with distinctly contemporary energy and glamour, the nearly century-old Hotel Vâ€™s modern and daring sense of diversity perfectly captures Amsterdamâ€™s spirit. Hotel V is perfectly located for sightseeing, shopping and socializing. Itâ€™s classic stone exterior opens onto a glowing entryway that prepares guests for the wonderland within. The exceptional hotel staff is willing and able to help you explore one of the worldâ€™s most gorgeous cities, offering tailored suggestions based on your interests.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel with some drawbacks”
Reviews.Author: Kayshaw Posted by an Easytobook.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Pros - Very clean, Excellent customer service, double XL room was really nice with King Size bed, breakfast OK, all day coffee at bar Cons - Tiny lift, no storage facility in bedroom, but was able to get a mobile one put in upon request, achitecture in bathroom and toilet not great, flooring, was vinyll hence cold. Overall, it is an OK hotel, but have stayed in better for the same value.

Reviews.Title: “Killer location, Great Staff, Late night bar.”
Reviews.Author: SirNose
Reviews.Content: If you are looking for a place to crash for the night in a wonderful central location in Amsterdam, this is it. Great hipster hang out spot on the ground floor with bar, fireplace, etc. Wonderful location near restaurants and museums. Only slight drawback is the size of the rooms. However, if you are here to enjoy the city, all you need is a very comfortable room with shower and toilet. The city is all about things to do and not about hanging out in your hotel room. The staff here is amazing! Super nice, helpful and accomodating. Love this place and highly recommend it to friends visiting Amsterdam.

Reviews.Title: “long weekend in amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: Elizabeth P Posted by an Easytobook.com traveler
Reviews.Content: the staff in the hotel were helpful and friendly and the breakfasts were great. we chose it because it looked stylish and was in a good location for us and it didn't disappoint. the rooms were clean and well equipped although small, the sheets were synthetic which was uncomfortable. it was a bit noisy as our room overlooked a main road but then it is amsterdam and most places will tend to be noisy. we had a lovely time.

Reviews.Title: “was ok”
Reviews.Author: Maria Christin M Posted by an Easytobook.com traveler
Reviews.Content: It was ok hotel, nicely presented and very clean. The staff didnt seem that helpful and it is not as close to central dam as advertised and also a little bit pricey for what you get. The room was very very small and we even looked at upgrading but that room was just as small. Maybe adding hot food to the breakfast as well would be good, other then that i enjoyed it.

Reviews.Title: “short break”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Easytobook.com traveler
Reviews.Content: good location, modern rooms nice but small bathroom, stayed in room 207 which was a bit noisy at night with guests coming and going. Good buffet breakfast, nice eating places nearby. Would stay at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel in great location.”
Reviews.Author: Jussi&Paul
Reviews.Content: Great hotel, yes the rooms are small but they are clean with excellent comfy beds & you don't go on a city break to spend time in your room! The location is excellent, nice & safe to walk around with good bars & restaurants nearby. Cafe Kale over the road is friendly & welcoming & they do a great cheese fondue. The bar area is good to relax in & chill out after a hard day sightseeing & the roaring fire & complimentary tea & coffee were a bonus. Would definitely recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Modern, friendly and good location”
Reviews.Author: cgt180
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for two nights mid week, 15 minute walk from town, 10 minutes from the metro and tram stop outside. Reception staff very helpful and helped me with directions, transport advice etc. Hotel has two buildings my room was at the top of some 'very' steep stairs which some might find difficult particularly with a big case. Breakfast was buffet style and plentiful. Free coffee and tea available, no evening meals as such but the Quiche from the bar was fantastic.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely”
Reviews.Author: Emma M Posted by an Easytobook.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Lovely hotel, brilliant location. Far enough away from the expensive centre and the stag parties. Highly recommend strolling around De Pijp and using that as your local neighbourhood. The bar, Cafe Kale, opposite the hotel is lovely. Staff are friendly and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant”
Reviews.Author: jamesnrose
Reviews.Content: A well located Hotel; away from the hustle and bustle of the busy Singel and Dam Square, and yet if you wander along a few streets, you can find yourselves in the Rembrandt quarter or Vongelpark/Museum Quarter. Great staff & individual hotel: the staff are friendly when you arrive and at breakfast and at any time of the day. You can get free tea or coffee from the bar at any time. Excellent. As well as this, the reception area is lovely and warm and cosy (there's a log fire, magazines, comfy sofas) where you can play cards, relax and unwind after a long day. Breakfast was excellent! Lots of choice and filling. Our room (401): right at the top of the hotel, which was a good thing as it meant we had to walk off our huge breakfast every morning. There's a small lift, not good if you're claustrophobic. We were upgraded to a King size bed, very very comfortable. Back window overlooking rooftops (nothing exciting). Smallish shower room/toilet, but does the job, also it's well ventilated and low lit. Cafe across the road is delightful too (as we discovered on out last day - the sandwiches are really good value for Amsterdam) Overall 10/10 :)

Reviews.Title: “friendliness and location”
Reviews.Author: Johnny H Posted by an Easytobook.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Very friendly reception and cleaning staff, the location is excellent with a tram stop right outside the door and a short and lovely walk to the city's centres. a very friendly and great wee pub across the road added to the pleasure of our stay.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing staff and hotel”
Reviews.Author: Tara H
Reviews.Content: We arrived in the snow to find that our apartment we had rented had no heat and the boiler could not be fixed. We booked a room for the night at V so that we could get on with Birthday celebrations - the staff could not have been more helpful and considerate. We had a basement room that was adequate for the night but not the best for 2 girls getting ready to party - however there was no problem in moving to another room for the next 2 nights! The rooms were clean, the staff were the nicest we have ever met and the tram stopped straight outside the hotel, though we walked everywhere as we were able to explore other parts of Amsterdam that we have missed in previous trips!! We had yet another wonderful weekend in Amsterdam that was aided by the wonderful staff and accomodation at Hotel V - we will be returning!!

Reviews.Title: “Great stay, fabulous staff”
Reviews.Author: JonTed
Reviews.Content: Just had a weekend in Amsterdam staying at the Hotel V. Excellent location, away from all of the vulgar touristy bits. Staff were incredibly attentive and nothing was too much trouble. Well appointed bar and lovely fire area, welcoming after dreadfully cold weather. If it wasn't for the inconsiderate other noisy guests I would give a 5/5. Highly recommended and would stay again

Reviews.Title: “OUTSTANDING STAY!”
Reviews.Author: gd4love
Reviews.Content: While in Europe, I stayed at Hotel V for three days and returned after a short excursion out of country for another four days. I am a big fan of this hotel from the old location and feared that in the move (a while now I know) they may have lost something. Not so! Highlights...my room included a bike (necessary for time in amsterdam); breakfast was delicious and fresh; everyone and i mean everyone working there was friendly and accomodating; speak a little Dutch and they are pleased with the effort. I would recommend this hotel to anyone. My room was very small and for me perfect! i had a nice balcony and view. This will be my requested room always (304). Now, as I write this, please remember that it is all for a great price. I had my laundry done and they even held some large items in between my two stays. They simply never said "no." For more money, I know that there are other places to stay and that must be considered in the evaluation. So, the location, the price, the experience... simply OUTSTANDING!

Reviews.Title: “Design hotel off the beaten track”
Reviews.Author: englebip
Reviews.Content: This is a beautiful hotel right in front of a tram stop (Frederiksplein). The lobby is very nice, the bar serves complimentary coffee and tea during your stay; the bad thing is that this only works during the open hours of the bar. We had a bit of an issue with the night receptionist, who took a lot of convincing to give us hot water for a tea when one of our party was feeling sick. He also couldn't help us find who to call for a health emergency. Fortunately, the wi-fi in the room helped us getting it solved ourselves. Breakfast is included (most hotels charge EUR12-18 per person) and it is quite a good value, but it's quite Dutch: no hot items (unless you count getting a bread right out of the oven as such). Also, the toilet drain in the room was quite noisy during the night, which was quite annoying. This was an issue in the first floor, but not when we stayed in the basement.

Reviews.Title: “Small but perfectly formed”
Reviews.Author: dominicjn
Reviews.Content: Great hotel away from the 'centre' of Amsterdam, but close enough to enjoy walking around the canals - and let's face it, nowhere is very far from anywhere in Amsterdam! The hotel is very well-designed (though the large gold bulldog in the entrance is a little on the odd side...) and uses the space available very well - the rooms are small, but very comfortable, the bar and breakfast areas are lovely and the staff friendly. Recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Style over substance”
Reviews.Author: sheldon128
Reviews.Content: A stylish, well-located hotel. Breakfast was included, but I was surprised to have to pay extra for eggs other than boiled. My room, a small double in the basement, was sparsely furnished, poorly lit, not carpeted and had a lot of bare concrete (presumably the modern style). The wardrobe was a pop up standing away from the wall. The TV was positioned at a poor angle and there was no headboard for the bed. I had a poor quality sleep due to the noise from the lift and stairs next to the room. On the positive side, the bed was comfortable, the staff friendly and the room was immaculately clean. The bathroom was spotless, modern and has a great shower. However, I think I would look elsewhere if I was to return to Amsterdam as the room was expensive (around Â£100) for what it was.

Reviews.Title: “Good not great”
Reviews.Author: GayTravelGuyDC
Reviews.Content: The hotel is perfectly fine. I really liked the public room downstairs. But, the overall stay was just average. The hotel room itself was nice, but could be a bit more functional. There was no closet, just a portable Ikea like wardrobe. The sloped ceiling made it a little difficult to get around the bed. I did really like the location. But, overall, I'd only give this stay an average rating.

Reviews.Title: “Public room great; bedrooms too small”
Reviews.Author: ErikBurger
Reviews.Content: Looking for a modern hip place to take our two grown-up sons and girlfriends we picked the V and were not disappointed. The lounge area is a lovely place to chill with its welcoming open fire and great design. All the staff are very friendly and try hard to please, in an informal and unobtrusive kind of way. The offer of free coffee and tea at all times is quite unique and draws many residents to the bar/lounge with its free-use Macs, lots of books and magazines and cosy sitting area. During our stay the typical guests were well-off professional early 30-sometings who were continiously updating their status on FaceBook and playing with their smartphones. Well chosen music (Jazz, R&B) helped to create a great atmoshere. The rooms were disappointingly small - we were actually struggling to find a place to put things such as mobile phones, keys, glasses and wallets - there is certainly no space to put your suitcases unless you like climbing over everything. To open and close the safe and read the instructions I had to lay on the floor, and there was insufficient space to hang clothes. However the double bed was very comfortable and the en-suite bathroom was of a perfectly aceptable seize and had a very good shower. We were on the 3rd. floor in the quieter annex- there is no lift and the staircase is very steep. If you are elderly, unfit or large you may be struggling here. During our stay we didn't see any children but we imagine they would be made most welcome. The hotel is obviously enjoying a high ocupancy rate and it is beginning to show as there is a lot of wear and tear to walls, doors and paintwork, and area's are beginning to look tired. If the V hotel continous to employ the excellent young staff and keeps up with maintenance and housekeeping it will stay very successfull and as a location (within walking distance from the old town centre, access to excellent public transport) you can't get it any better.

Reviews.Title: “Interesting vibe and well placed”
Reviews.Author: Krishan A
Reviews.Content: Go for the rooms at the back - the larger ones are at the front but there's a tram stop right outside. That makes it very handy for the ride into town, a few minutes away. Some might find the all-black corridors and floors a bit Goth but I thought it worked well. Free wifi in the rooms and the foyer, not as common as you'd think in Amsterdam. And the staff were absolutely charming. Highly recommended

Reviews.Title: “A "V" good weekend”
Reviews.Author: PMY
Reviews.Content: When we arrived and checked in, we initially felt that the rooms were small - particularly with two people sharing - but as the weekend progressed we got to really enjoy the look and feel of the property. This was largely due to the attentiveness of the staff in reception and at the bar, the cleanliness and unobtrusive housekeeping staff and the lovely, fresh continental breakfast which was very well laid out. Location was ideal with the No 4 tram into Centraal Station stopping outside and the gorgeous Utrecht Strasse and Albert Cuyp market just around the corners. THe design features of the hotel have been thought out very well and whilst it may not be to everybody's tase, it is comfortable, clean and welcoming. They have made the very ebst of the building. If I would make any recommendations, it would be not to allow staff to smoke in an area that is highly frequented by the guests and offer a late night drink for residents who want to have a nightcap as we ended up giving our business to the pub across the way and then went back again the next day - revenue the hotel could otherwise have enjoyed. Complimentary Tea & Coffee in the lounge and use of the internet free in reception was appreciated, although anything we asked for at the desk or bar was met with great response from very knowledgeable staff. I return with great memories of a lovely weekend and thanks for a comfortable stay. Btw Amsterdam is a really fun place during the day and ALL night!

Reviews.Title: “A beautiful, romantic place to escape to.”
Reviews.Author: Justine S
Reviews.Content: I wanted to take my husband away for a romantic getaway to celebrate his birthday and I was certainly not disappointed. I know the city very well and so knew that it was not right in the centre but I did not want to be amongst all of that when I eventually went to sleep. And besides, it's only about 5 minutes away from the Rembrantsplein! The rooms are quite small but they are clean with modern, tasteful decor. The breakfasts are great for a buffet and I loved the fact that I could get free tea, coffee and hot chocolate from the bar anytime I wanted during the day and evening. The staff were always helpful and friendly. I would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Decent hotel, better if you know Amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: nickandtash
Reviews.Content: Stayed here on a last minute emergency for 1 night, i payed very little so Im not someone who pays a 3 star price and then complains that its not a 5 star. Location is a little of the beaten tourist track, but i have to say if it was more central I'm guessing the rates would be quite a bit higher. Its right in front in front of a tram stop which is a plus. Really well deigned 'design' hotel, decorated to a high level, very tasteful and modern Breakfast was really good continental breakfast. Staff were very friendly, making conversation and very helpful. Rooms, as I said I payed very little so i got what i payed for which is fine, single room in the basement, it was teeny tiny, but in a cute way and still well designed. If I was staying longer or paid more I think it would have become an issue.

Reviews.Title: “Clean design hotel”
Reviews.Author: KrisVH
Reviews.Content: Clean design hotel, good breakfast, comfy beds, free wifi, one negative point are the windows with single glass, they are not very noise canceling and the rooms on the pictures are looking bigger.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel V Fredreiksplein - nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: MissAY
Reviews.Content: Went 1-4 September 2011 and I was pleased with the breakfast and room. Only wish the location was a bit closer to the city centre, but the tram ride is quite swift. My guess is that if it were closer it would have cost a lot more! Much better than my last experience in Amsterdam (Hotel Bema - read my review - I shall say no more!) The staff were friendly and it was a safe location that you could take nice walks from. I would probably come back!

Reviews.Title: “Very Tiny Room Downstairs”
Reviews.Author: gordi00728
Reviews.Content: Good: This has a great location. It is right by the Rjistaadt, Van Gogh and Henienken Experience. Within walking distance but you can also take the tram which is like an elevated subway. The tram stop in literally right in front of the hotel and they sell tram passes at the hotel. It will take you all across the city and to Centraal Station for trains and airport shuttle. It also is in a quaint neighborhood with restaurants and bars. The service from the staff was really good and their English was the best in Europe. They have Wi-Fi and 2 computers near the front desk with free internet. they will also print anything for you. The bar area seemed very modern and up to date. N Bad: This is all about the room. We stayed one night and thank goodness that is all. We were downstairs in a room which is the size of a normal American bathroom. There was not even room to open our luggage. This did not look like any pictures of rooms that I saw. it also said there was a safe. We searched and never found one. For $186 a night, this was a joke. The bed was a double thank goodness. There was a rolling closet but it could not hold much. We will not even talk about how small the bathrooms are. Lets just say we were glad we stayed out really late so we could just come home and sleep. We left the next day at 5am so overall it was only a place to crash and dash. I would not stay here again, but I would come for a drink.

Reviews.Title: “Cute but too small”
Reviews.Author: BusyBeeEssex
Reviews.Content: I travelled here for a trip with friends. The hotel is designed very nicely - however I do not see this as a hotel that gives value for money. The rooms are incredibly basic and SMALL!!! - the breakfast is standard and the location is not so near the main square. Staff do try to accommodate and although ive stayed at boutique hotels - this one is not there yet.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it :)”
Reviews.Author: katie c
Reviews.Content: Me and my boyfriend have just come back from Amsterdam and we stayed here for 3 nights. You couldnt ask for a better hotel, the staff are all lovely, the hotel is very modern and decorated really nice. There's a tram station literally right outside the hotel and all you need to do is catch tram number 4 or 25 to go to Dam Square (where all the main attractions are). The trams also run every 10 minutes so you couldnt miss a tram if you tried to. We were based in the basement of the hotel and after reading the other reviews of how small the rooms were, they are small but if your like us and not botherd about the room size and you just need a bed to sleep in then thats all that matters, But if your willing to pay extra just to get a bigger room then i would advise you to do that. Next time we are visiting the hotel we are going to get a bigger room only because it would be nice just get a bit of leg room and to walk about the room a lot more. All in all a really nice hotel, i couldnt fault it at all. We will be definetly staying here next time we visti Amsterdam :)

Reviews.Title: “We liked this hotel”
Reviews.Author: JohnJurik1
Reviews.Content: V (the actual name of the hotel - Fredericksplein is just the location) is located south of the city center, 30 minutes walking or 10 minutes from the metro station. The location is a fairly quiet neighborhood only 10 minutes walking to the museums (Rijks and Van Gogh). The first thing you notice is how good the staff is. Everyone was young, spoke fluent english, and were very helpful and nice. the lobby is very nice looking - large windows overlooking the street, modern architecture, and a nice fireplace. They offer free coffee/tea/hot chocolate at any time. The free breakfast down here was also very nice. Our room was nice - although probably the smallest of any we stayed in in Europe. As other reviewers have noted, not a big deal if you spend most of your time sightseeing. Overall a good value for our money and we would recommend this hotel highly.

Reviews.Title: “Little Gem”
Reviews.Author: Shammyowens
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel for a weekend in Amsterdam in April 2010. The hotel is a little gem and everything you need for a good weekend away. The hotel is about 30-40 minutes walk from the Central station or about a 5 minute tram ride. We walked to get our bearings of the City. Although the hotel is not right in the centre, this is good for sleep quality, the road is very quiet in the evening which is good considering the nightlife in the City. The rooms were quite small but perfectly formed making use of all available space (wall mounted TV). We had a shower room which was lovely and very stylish. The bed was very comfortable. There is not tea or coffee facilities, but you could get these free from the bar downstairs. A little annoying if you do not want to leave the room, but the quality of the coffee is better as they have a proper machine and don't use instant.....it just depends what your preference is, convenience or quality? A continental breakfast was included and the selection was very good indeed. A brilliant way to start your days activities! The bar was quite cool although pretty quiet when we went. It was great for a first drink before going out on the town, the bar staff were very chatty and really helpful. When you are in Amsterdam check out Harrys Bar. Top quality cocktails and free nibbles, there is a great vibe and we spent quite a long time there.

Reviews.Title: “Quite comfortable!”
Reviews.Author: Dmitry_Ivanov
Reviews.Content: I was there during IBC (September, 2011). It's always a problem to book a room for this time, so I used RAI Hotel & Travel Service to book it in advance. The hotel located approx. in the middle between city center and RAI, so location is quite convenient. Room was very small (as usual in Amsterdam), in the second building, no lift. But it was quite comfortable room, with view to quiet garden and soft & big bed. Typical breakfast, very friendly staff. Just a couple of small disadvantages: no any desk in the room (even small one, take a laptop stand if you're going to work in bed) and very minimalistic storage.

Reviews.Title: “Stylish, Classy but Still Needs Some Improvement”
Reviews.Author: Prudala
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Hotel V for 3 nights recently during my first visit to Amsterdam. I scoured reviews and web sites looking for the perfect place to stay that also fit my aesthetic tastes and price range. Hotel V was the best option based on my parameters. It has a really lovely, modern, chic vibe and look. The staff are also so warm and wonderful with their assistance from dinner remmendations to ticket reservations. The location is perfect-- accessible to everything, especially by tram, which is right in front!-- and not too close to the busy tourist center for a tourist who likes to be away from the bustle moderately so. The breakfast and service are great; and the free coffee, cappuccino, and tea throughout the day is a wonderful touch. Now, to the room... I stayed in a double on the fourth floor to which you must take the stairs after taking the small lift to the third floor. It felt like a nestled attic or loft space, tastefully designed, BUT as most reviews have said, the rooms are small. As a solo traveler, that was bearable. However, I was displeased that there is no place for suitcases, which must lie on the floor; and the low (poor) lighting, which makes it difficult to see, especially in the bathroom; and the lack of a shower enclosure to a nicely tiled rainshower that gets the floor really wet. I was mopping (with extra towels) after each shower and tracking water into the bedroom- no fun. The windows could also use screens to keep mosquitoes at bay after the near daily rain that one can experience in AMS. So these are just areas for improvement, in my opinion. I really liked the hotel, its location, and vibe; I'm less superlative about the certain (key) aspects of the room- hence my review title. Next time I might try another place but I'd still consider Hotel V.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, friendly at a reasonable price”
Reviews.Author: LoveDziuba
Reviews.Content: The hotel rooms are very small but very clean and neat. If you are going to Amsterdam to sit in a hotel room I wouldnâ€™t recommend this one, but if you are going to use it just to sleep and rest then youâ€™ve found the right place for a reasonable price. The staff is very friendly and helpful. The breakfast is amazing (donâ€™t expect fried bacon as this is not America), everything is fresh and there are many dishes to choose from. If you don't mind walking, it's about 30 min to get to the city center. Would definitely stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “Look forward to go back again!”
Reviews.Author: rhodos34
Reviews.Content: This was my fourth visit to Amsterdam,a short one actually because it was just for one stay during a visit to Germany and Holland. Hotel V is just what I like.Ellegant ,clean rooms,good location (right opposite the tram stop,close enough to walk and explore around but more quiet than centrally located hotels),excellent breakfast(had plenty of choice, good quality ),the lobby area is very nice to relax (I imagine that is better winter times with the fireplace in the middle). The only complaint is that the rooms are really very small and more hanging space needed in bedroom (no wardrobe) If you like more spacious rooms book a 'large' room (we were there with no luggages at all ,so we booked the most inexpensive room). Staff very friendly and helpful (hotel offers the most design map of Amsterdam I 've seen-with black and gold design). Afterall I believe is good value for money . Recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Almost Perfect”
Reviews.Author: gregcmorley
Reviews.Content: This hotel was great all around. The service started off at the top and never let up. The warm atmosphere of the lobby area was a great place to relax and unwind. The rooms were clean and attractive. The breakfast was very full and well prepared. We would stay here again and highly recommend it to travelers to Amsterdam.

Reviews.Title: “Cool & Friendly !”
Reviews.Author: frogforbez
Reviews.Content: Me and 8 friends rode to the hotel from Central station on our hired pushbikes from Mikes bikes behind the train station. Journey took around 20 minutes situated in a nice part of Amsterdam away from the tourist trap areas Hotel looks very funky from the outside we were able to check in early The only compalint i have is the rooms really very small - could hardly swing a cat! And was very stingy with the shower gell soap etc - Had 2 small tubes but these ran out and were not replaced the next day. Breakfast was nice and fresh rolls,cereals, ham, eggs tea/coffer fresh juice all for around Â£100 per night !! Very good as i have friends who have paid Â£150 for 2 star hotels Yep if we came again wed stay here - oh forgot to say free hot drinks during ur stay!! Beer prices were around Â£3 for a bottle of heineken - very good seen as they are Â£5 in Dam square area oh and my freind said their was happy hour 6-7 half price drinks!! but i cant confirm as were not at the hotel at the time. Great stay thou - very happy !!

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay!”
Reviews.Author: GinnyNorfolk
Reviews.Content: My husband and I booked this hotel last minute for a weekend away. We stayed in a small double room, which was small, but actually the size didn't cause any problem. The bathroom was modern and clean and the bed was so comfortable I had to set an alarm each day to stop us sleeping in! We found the staff really helpful, the breakfast great and the free tea, coffee and hot chocolate at the bar a nice touch. The location was good too, right opposite the tram stop. We were close enough to walk to the busy spots, but far enough away to benefit from the quiet surroundings.

Reviews.Title: “Trendy hotel - opt for the XL room”
Reviews.Author: LouiseHenkel
Reviews.Content: The XL Double room was spacious, beautiful, new, and very clean. The bed was wonderful! I liked the lighting, it made the room look bigger and gave it a romantic feel. The toilet and the shower were actually in two seperate rooms. The lift didn't go all the way upstairs, so we ended up carrying our bags for the last floor. The lobby looked inviting and the receptionists were nice. The breakfast was OK; continental breakfast. The location is the only drawback. If you're going on a romantic holiday like us and don't mind the 10 minute walk it is OK (and there are shops and restaurants on the way to the city), but we never came back to the hotel during the day to rest our feet because of the distance. There is a busstop right outside the hotel, but we never used public transportation while in Amsterdam. If I went back it would have to be with a partner. If I went with a girlfriend or larger family I would definitely want to stay closer to the city. All in all though this was a very pleasant stay and we loved the room which was very different from any other room we've slept in.

Reviews.Title: “Clean hotel, very friendly staff but very small and a little out of the way”
Reviews.Author: gemma0369
Reviews.Content: Positives... Right next to a tram stop with two trams serving directly from Central Station - great when you have suitcases! Very friendly staff - helpful, gave tips on what to see/do/where to go, spoke fluent English, no problems in that respect! Also very clean! Apple Macs in reception for people to use as and when you want! And free wifi throughout the hotel anyway... Bikes that could be hired (although we didn't, they looked to be good!) Not far from Rembrant Square (approx 10 minute walk) - good bars, cafes, nightlife... Perfect location for the Heineken Brewery! Rooms have a safe in them and plenty of socket in room for charging cameras, phones etc - always handy as you usually only get one socket! Showers were also good... Negatives... Perhaps not quite central enough for the main hubbub of the city! - we are active walkers and do a lot of city breaks, but walking to Dam Square and back and seeing all nightlife (Red Light!) made it a little too far when wanting to go to the central areas everyday...which was a shame. Breakfast was 'ok' but by no means great...a few limited cereal options and other continental breakfast options (croissants etc) but not an overwhelming choice of options...could have been better...(great tea/coffee cups though!) The room...this was the biggest disappointment - we had a souterrain room (small double in the basement)...we had read reviews before about it being 'small' so we were prepared...but it wasn't small, it was REALLY small...(the other rooms aren't much bigger anyway) - it's also very dark (despite having windows) as everything is painted black!...for a couple away for 3 days with two small suitcases this was VERY cramped! There are four coathangers to hang things up in a little makeshift 'wardrobe' (not really a wardrobe) and no where else to store clothes...we were living out of our suitcases (not ideal really!). Also very noisy - being in the basement under reception/lobby area means you hear everything...lies in not a possibility! Overall...an average hotel ...bear in mind the drawbacks if you're booking...

Reviews.Title: “very good hotel, location ,facilities and price.”
Reviews.Author: krisb59
Reviews.Content: Great location for exploring both the old part of town and the museum area. Trams stop right outside. Nice boutique hotel , good decoration and facilities . Staff very friendly and helpful . buffet breakfast had plenty of choice, good quality and locally produced where ever possible . Rooms on top floor only accessible by stairs as lift stops 1 floor below. Glad we booked a 'large' room ( would hate to see a small one!) good shower/wet room but more hanging space needed in bedroom (no wardrobe) All in all and good choice and good value for money . Recomended.

Reviews.Title: “everything was "yes yes yes" (but in a subdued cool dutch way)”
Reviews.Author: JoshLawrenceSmith
Reviews.Content: amazing location! awesome breakfast. (in order to accommodate my gluten free girlfriend it was just a matter of asking) the service was competent, polite and curt. i wouldn't say 'friendly' but i've heard this is the dutch way. the rooms were tiny, but clean and smart. i will probably stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “great location, comfortable, trendy, very friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: emma190821
Reviews.Content: We booked he hotel v just a few weeks before our stay as it was a surprise 21st birthday present for my boyfriend. I was very nervous before our trip as i had heard some scary stories about amsterdam but found that these were just that scary STORIES! From the moment we arrived to the moment we left the staff could not do enough to help you. There were no tea and coffee facilities in the room however you could go down to he bar and request one at any time and they were free of charge with a vast selection of teas many ive never even heard of before( and i work in catering). Ive read on some reviews of the hotel that the beds were not comfortable but this is not the case. I think i have more of an idea than most as unfortunately we arrived on the saturday and i contracted food poisoning from one of the burger kings in the city on the sunday night and spent the rest of my stay in bed!!! We had 2 friends who stayed at another hotel who arrived 2 days before us and left he day after we had arrived and found that hey had spent most of their money on taxis as their hotel was a good distance away from the centre. They paid only Â£20 each less than us and we were in a prime location, Not so close as to be kept up all night by rowdy revellers but within a close walking distance - in fact we only used public transport to the hotel and back to the station on the way home. The rooms were not huge but they were enough for two to stay comfortabley and besides you dont go on holiday to stay in the hotel the whole time. The bathroom was amazingly decorated and kept very clean with fresh towels every morning. I cannot comment on the breakfast buffet as i never sampled it but my boyfriend who doesnt eat breakfast went down for a cigarette and said it looked amazing. The trams do go right past the front of the hotel and you can hear them at night but i think you would struggle to find anywhere in the city where this would not be the case. The nearest coffee shops if youre into that kind of thing are the coffee shop little and mellow yellow. Right across the road from the hotel is a lovely restaurant where we sat and had a drink outside but did not eat as the menu was mainly in dutch. Dam square is about a 10 minute walk and the hotel staff will provide you with a map and details of any trams that you might need to take. All in all apart from the food poisoning that ruined my trip, we had a fantastic stay and have already discussed that should we return in the future that this will be the place. If you stop here i dont think you will be disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Well located and friendly”
Reviews.Author: PM_in_SF
Reviews.Content: Our room was in the basement with a small window and the overhead light was out. That was the bad. The overwhelming good was, while very small, the room was comfortable with excellent bathroom and smart modern-style fixtures. The location is great - just in the City Center and close to the Museum/Park Quarter. The staff is warm, friendly and attentive and the bicycle option is very useful, as bikes are the best way for travelling the city center. The bar is really nice and the continental breakfast very generous.

Reviews.Title: “A very contemporary and modern hotel”
Reviews.Author: Pattinson50
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed are stay very Much. The hotel is all marble, which was clean. The rooms had everything you needed, flat screen tv, office area, safe in the room, even a hairdryer. The beds was comfortable, and excellent bedding. The staff was all very friendly and their English was good. The tram stop was straight out side, and staff give you a map and the tram numbers of what you will need, to where you are going. Continental breakfast was great. The only thing We could say was the taxi didn't know where the hotel was, so make sure you take the full address with you, and the glass front doors, the whole front of building was glass and the doors do not stand out. 4 out of 5.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel located near the tram but with an expensive small room”
Reviews.Author: SoldatosG
Reviews.Content: A very modern hotel located near the tram which makes it very easy for using public transport and moving from place to place.The breakfast was excellent.It's major drawback was the room.We chose the standard double room but the room we stayed in was not even for one person!!!.No place to leave your luggage and clothes.Very tiny bathroom.The room maid threw away the soap and forgot to bring a new one back!!...Apart from that,the staff was very friendly and polite.Great lobby.Internet access.

Reviews.Title: “Modern, clean and friendly.”
Reviews.Author: neverturnright
Reviews.Content: Great location, Great beds (i really liked them but i had just travelled 24 hours), Helpful young staff with a can do attitude. Loft rooms are spacious but no lift access to top floor, walk the last flight. Small lift & bathrooms. Great location to explore. Caught tram 25 & 4 from out front to Central Station and all in between or just start walking. The street market a few blocks behind hotel is good. It's modern, clean and friendly. No mini bar or tea/coffee facilities in room but nice sitting downstairs and people watching. The hotel map very good highlights all the necessary streets, parks & attractions.

Reviews.Title: “Modern arty hotel , not bad, would recommend”
Reviews.Author: MauveOrchid
Reviews.Content: Pro: arty and modern feel, good breakfast , nice reception area Con: Our room was located in the adjacent building and as this was previously a bookshop, we had to go up extremely steep staircase. A bit dangerous actually . The sheets looked ok but not spotless... I think this is because they were a dark colour which I didn't feel too comfortable about

Reviews.Title: “Bad beds, but otherwise excellent.”
Reviews.Author: noerlyng
Reviews.Content: This was our first trip abroad together without our 1 year old baby (and a b-day pressie from me to my boyfriend). I had done a lot of hotel research and found this hotel to be good value for money. Which overall it was. But the beds were tiny (maybe because the rooms were small) and the matresses poor, so we hardly got any sleep which was one of the purposes of being away from our child... We got another room, but with the same bed problems. If it hadn't been for the poor beds, I would have ranked this hotel very high as it was very cool and the breakfast really good. Also, it was situated in a quiet location.

Reviews.Title: “Trendy, good service, good room and good location, but paper walls..”
Reviews.Author: Travellina70
Reviews.Content: We stayed here a couple of nights and the hotel was what I expected - very trendy, nice rooms and good location. There was a tram station right outside the hotel that took us back and forth to the train central station. Otherwise we walked from the hotel around the city. They give you a city map upon arrival that is very good, points out different places worth seeing. The room was fairly small but clean and very nice. Also the bed was good. Unfortunately though, we had a room on the street side on the first floor and I couldn't really sleep due to the traffic sounds outside. Also, we could hear every step from the above room where we were unfortunate to have neighbors that was walking back and forth on their heels very late for hours, don't understand why. Not the hotels fault of course, but just making a point that a light sleeper might have problems. My husband however, slept just fine - he agreed we could hear everything a little too well, but if one can sleep in spite of different sounds around, then it is no problem. Overall, a nice hotel - I would stay again, but I would ask for a room on the top floor and on not on the street side :)

Reviews.Title: “A very pleasant hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: susanwalsh
Reviews.Content: I travelled with my 21 year old daughter who liked the quirkiness of the decor.Our room was good though a little more storage space would have been helpful(eg bedside tables with drawers) We had a safe which was excellent and the beds were very comfortable. Breakfast was very good and plentiful and free hot drinks at any time was a great bonus. The staff were delightful and gave us some great recommendations for restaurants. Over all staying at Hotel V was very good and we would go again.

Reviews.Title: “Small but chic!”
Reviews.Author: MFig
Reviews.Content: Super tiny rooms, but this hotel has such great charm. The staff is incredibly friendly and the overall feel of the hotel is warm and welcoming. The trams are right across the street from the hotel, making it easy to get around the city if you dont want to walk. Two streets down is Oliveto, a must stop for any foodie!

Reviews.Title: “Would stay here again”
Reviews.Author: Katrina8686
Reviews.Content: Very friendly and helpful staff at reception, maid service and breakfast staff. Not so friendly manager/bar manager who questioned who'd given me 2 free drinks tickets and who told my partner he couldn't get coffee until 11am as they were clearing up after breakfast! We only had reason to speak to him twice and twice he did not give good customer service. On arrival we were given a smaller room than expected, with little light, but after mentioning this to reception they were more than happy to move us to the XL Double room we had booked. Very clean, good breakfast, stylish hotel. Could be improved with better lighting in bedrooms and carpets.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, Modern, Tiny Rooms”
Reviews.Author: Jeanette_Goz
Reviews.Content: After reading the reviews, I was expecting a small room but I was still quite shocked of how small the bedroom and bathroom really are. We took a standard double room on the first floor. The room although clean and nicely designed, is quite dark despite the large window. There is no where to hang clothes and so all of our clothes were kept in their suitcases. The bathroom is also tiny. No where to place the toiletries and so we kept all of our toiletries (except toothbrushes) in the suitcases as well. On a positive note, the staff are really friendly and helpful, the lobby is lovely, hot drinks are on the house (as much as you want), breakfast is great and there are two apple computers which we used all the time to communicate to our kids. The location is great and close to public transport. Overall, we had a positive experience at this hotel but it is a pity that such a lovely hotel made such tiny rooms....

Reviews.Title: “The most amazing staff ever!”
Reviews.Author: hellomichelle
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Hotel V for our first trip to Amsterdam with the hubby and we both had an amazing time. We can't wait for a future trip and future stay! Overall, it's a very hip and trendy hotel and the staff are hip and trendy as well. First of all, their staff is the best ever! They greeted us every morning before breakfast (some by name), helped us plan our daily activities, made restaurant recommendations and dinner reservations, and would chat with us over the free hot drinks (hot chocolate, tea, latte, etc.) in the lobby before the end of the day. They know the city well and are truly passionate about helping visitors enjoy Amsterdam like the locals. The breakfast spread was great - wide range of choices and very delicious. We looked forward to breakfast! Coming to Amsterdam/Europe, we expected rooms to be small, which is why we upgraded to the XL room, which offered us a balcony and street view...The XL room had a very large comfy bed and great trendy decor, though the room was still small for the highest upgrade. The bathroom space was really small too - and we thought that for the price and size, Hotel V should at least offer more room amenities to compensate for the price (they offer shampoo, soap, and body wash only)...just a little suggestion. Hotel V is right across a tram stop (which you can hear throughout the day from your room, but it's no big deal and not a bothersome) and is located near some great attractions (like the museums, great restaurants, the Heineken Experience). Amsterdam is relatively small and we didn't even use the trams...we walked all over AND conveniently rented the bikes that the hotel offered. They offer free wifi as well as have two computers in the lobby. When hotels do this for free, that's always a plus. Also, they have multiple wifi signals so you'll always have a connection. Overall, I would HIGHLY recommend staying at Hotel V. It's a great experience and we would definitely go back and stay at this Hotel on future trips. THANK YOU HOTEL V!

Reviews.Title: “Professional Staff - Excellent Location”
Reviews.Author: cabenson
Reviews.Content: Recently stayed at Hotel V and had a great time. The Hotel is located on the tram line and took minutes to get to/from the office. The staff was great and were able to point me in the right direction whenever needed. Great stay - will stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Stay”
Reviews.Author: pletchHeidelberg
Reviews.Content: First, when staying in Amsterdam, nothing is big; not hotel rooms or showers or parking. Having said that, the hotel was great! It is a very conservative hotel from the front, but when you walk in you are greeted by a very warm and comfortable lobby complete with a sunken lounge area with fireplace. The front desk staff is well informed and courteous, and took very good care of us. The rooms are small by American standards but are clean. Make sure you book your room with one of the packages, such as the museum package like we did. You get express entrance into two of the big venues, avoiding the hour plus wait in line, and at a significantly reduced price. The beds, I canâ€™t say enough; these were the best hotel beds I have ever stayed in, EXTREMELY comfortable! One challenge we had in the room was hot water; there is plenty of pressure, but the water wasnâ€™t as hot as some people like it. The highlight of the hotel was the bar, more specifically Julian, the bar tender/manager/super hero/know everything you need to enjoy your stay. Julian was nothing short of spectacular! He was able and more than willing to help us with every question we had, and he ran an extremely efficient and friendly staff of service personnel and he made the stay so much more enjoyable. Kudos to the hotel management for an outstanding hotel and the selection of a great staff.

Reviews.Title: “NOT good value for money”
Reviews.Author: vangos7
Reviews.Content: This i a very modern and trendy hotel, in a good location (but not extremely central), very convenient for public transport and with helpful and relaxed staff. The breakfast is quite good and plentiful, there is free tea, coffee and hot chocolate for guests all day, and the style of the hotel is undeniable. There was even a music event on Sunday evening during my stay, with some performers, a band, poetry reading, and a large, young and vibrant crowd. Nevertheless, the quality of the rooms and the minimal service does not justify the prices of this hotel. I would have given a much more favourable review, especially considering all the above pros, if this was a budget hotel. Unfortunately, with these prices, what you get is budget services, for the price of a 4 star hotel. The rooms are extremely small, even if a larger room is requested. The normal/smaller rooms are tiny! There is hardly room to stand, and practically no room to open your suitcases. The layout of the rooms is also extremely unorthodox making the space feel even more confined. The bathrooms are claustrophobic and impractical. I personally am not bothered by loud noises, but if you wake up easily you can forget enjoying a good nights sleep: the tram stop right in front of the hotel means that you can hear the tram bells every 5-10 minutes throughout the night. And I am probably nitpicking now, but I had to raise an eyebrow with the floorplan around the hotel, especially the lobby area where there are several different floor levels, often with hidden steps, or with uneven, varied-sized stairs. I wonder how safe this layout can be, especially for older or handicapped guests. In a nutshell, if you can get this hotel for (much) less than 100 euros, or if the most important quality in a hotel for you is style and you don't care about anything else, go for it. Otherwise, there are much better hotels, often for less money.

Reviews.Title: “tiny room, big price”
Reviews.Author: daveyk17
Reviews.Content: Staff were great, hotel looked good and the breakfast was excellent BUT the room was really tiny and at Â£100 a night very poor value.

Reviews.Title: “The smallest room ever”
Reviews.Author: Felicityg2001
Reviews.Content: We thought the hotel itself was well presented, the staff very friendly and the bar area comfortable and well appointed. The breakfast was average. The hotel is in a great location just outside the main city areas and you can get the tram straight from Centraal Station on the 4 or 25 route which only takes 10 mins at most so very handy for exploring. What we were shocked by was the size of our room. Granted we booked a small double but it was tiny. One friend commented it was like a cabin in a small boat. The bed took up the whole room and the only storage was a small fabric wardrobe which was like an Ikea laundry unit. There are no tea or coffee facilities in the room but the bar offers free tea and coffee. There is no door on the shower so water sprays out of the shower onto the bathroom floor and you have to put towels down to stop flooding the tiny bathroom. We paid 109 euros for the night and did not think the room was worth it. The bigger rooms did look more comfortable but even our friends who booked a large double were shocked by the size of the rooms. My advice to you would be to find out from the hotel which are their most spacious rooms before booking.

Reviews.Title: “small, very small, too small”
Reviews.Author: Madec
Reviews.Content: We booked a large room but got a small room. We asked for another room and got a room under the roof which looked slightly more comfortable than the first one but was as small with a bathroom for dwarves (not exaggerated). Mirror at stomach height. Hardly any light: impossible to shave or get ready. Sleeping was another problem: beds were too hot because of the mattresses. We'll never be back.

Reviews.Title: “THE BEST ONE”
Reviews.Author: LnSgal
Reviews.Content: All is very GOOD !!! just that for my impression ... thank's the crew and please, GO THERE !!!!! your holidays will be extraordinary !! thank's again ! See you soon HÃ©lÃ¨ne

Reviews.Title: “One of the best”
Reviews.Author: LeopoldBruce
Reviews.Content: Staying at Hotel V was a marvelous experience. You have got to credit the apty-friendly and hospitable staff. The entire atmosphere is chilled out. It's a hotel that's basically not a hotel in the sense that in my view it's not a typical hotel where you just go sleep after a busy day. It is a place to meet new people, relax, explore the city and enjoy the comfort of the staff. These guys know everything there is to know about Amsterdam. They recommended a restaurant, which turned out to be a top-notch place to eat. Their price is certainly reasonable for a city like Amsterdam. Their central location makes others envious. You basically can get anywhere thanks to the hotel's perfect location. Their breakfast was delicious. Everything seemed to work. I would recommend this hotel because it's a kind of hotel that you will enjoy even if you aint hip-minded. Everyone seems welcome at V. I certainly would go back if I had another chance. It's certainly a hotel of its kind: unique!

Reviews.Title: “Very welcoming”
Reviews.Author: WorldTraveller201120
Reviews.Content: The hotel is very well located. You can walk everywhere. From the train station you can take the tram nÂº4 and it leaves you just in front of the hotel. Staff is very nice. The room had a good size and the mattress is very comfortable. The lobby is a perfect spot to relax with the fire and the free hot drinks. The apple pie is just delicious!!! Will come back for sure!

Reviews.Title: “Non breathing sardine with no baggage? Stay here!”
Reviews.Author: Ellioralions
Reviews.Content: Room is so tiny that we can't even open our bags! Reception gave us a free drink which was lovely. Bed had an annoying bed that creaked every time I breathed! When I finished showering I was standing on the toilet. An interesting and uncomfortable stay.

Reviews.Title: “decent budget hotel, if you get a good price”
Reviews.Author: sirtravel
Reviews.Content: The hotel is OK. Everything about it is OK. Not great. Not bad. OK. The location is OK. Halfway between de Pijp/Amsterdam Zuid and the Center. You cancatch the 4 or 25 tram to the Center just outside the hotel. But the general area around the hotel is just OK. Not great. Not bad. OK The rooms are OK. I don't understand why going out to Ikea for furniture and laying pebble tiles makes a place "designer". The rooms were small but adequate. The bathrooms were small but adequate. The furniture is institutional and the television is located inconveniently for watching from the bed. This is a problem, since there is limited seating in the room. Not great. Not bad. OK The breakfast was very good. Lot's of choice -- fresh breads, rolls + croissant, coffee, tea, cappucino, fresh meats and cheeses, fruits, etc. This was really OK.

Reviews.Title: “Relax and live amsterdam...”
Reviews.Author: psarmento
Reviews.Content: It has small rooms, but you feel at home with the excellent service! You wake up, find reviews with the free wifi or lobby internet, have an excellent breakfast from 7 till 11 and they ask you what do you want of Amsterdam: tourism, coffeehouse, museums, bar, fashion restaurant, live like a local... Afterwords, you arrive, stay a while in the cozy living room, along the fireplace, and they serve you a free tea or hot chocolate. Do you want more? ask!

Reviews.Title: “Too expensive for its value”
Reviews.Author: apanag
Reviews.Content: The hotel is too expensive for the services it offers. The room is very cold. We complained and they just ignored us. The room (standard double) is really tiny and it doesn't even have a chair. It is relatively clean, but not enough for 130 euros/night. The breakfast was poor and low quality: no fresh orange juice, horrible fruits etc. We asked for water at night and they charged 5 euros for a liter of water in a carton box. Location was just ok, not far by still a good 10 minutes tram ride from the center. I definitely don't recommend it; for that money you can take something much better.

Reviews.Title: “Stylish but painfully small”
Reviews.Author: jonnyred
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Hotel V for a long weekend in October. The hotel is very stylish, with a lovely lobby/bar area, but the rooms are very small - almost uncomfortably so. We couldn't help but think the designer had been a little greedy trying to cram so many rooms into such a small space. The service was patchy - we found it to be rather curt at times but this seemed to be the case all over Amsterdam. That said, we were granted a late check-out when we requested it, and some of the staff at breakfast were very friendly and helpful. The free wifi and tea & coffee all day in the lobby is great. The location of the hotel is a little off the beaten track, but you can walk almost anywhere within 20 minutes or so, and there is a tram stop right outside.

Reviews.Title: “Relaxed Design Hotel”
Reviews.Author: pentigara
Reviews.Content: Quite central hotel with modern styled rooms. Positive: - free Wifi - quite central, 10 minutes by tram from Dam - tram station right in front of hotel - good breakfast - friendly - nice bathroom and shower with very large showerhead ("rainforest shower") - modern styled - flatscreen tv negative: - I had to stay in a "souterrain"-room (i.e. a room in the basement) with a very slim window at the top of the room, so basically no daylight. - small rooms without a desk - relatively pricey rate for a room in the basement (100Euros/night incl. breakfast). I booked on short notice though and hotels seem to be expensive in Amsterdam Basically I recommend the hotel, but I was unpleasantly surprised by the room in the basement. On the other hand, other colleagues of mine stayed in the Novotel Krasnapolsky (fully booked at the time) and their window looked straight at a wall of about 1.5m distance. So actually, not much better...

Reviews.Title: “Will definately stay here again”
Reviews.Author: Susannaka
Reviews.Content: Stylish hotel, smart interiors, extremely friendly staff, good breakfest, internet access in the lobby, good location close to De Pijp bar & restaurant area. Only downside that rooms were quite small with almost no storage possibilities, such as shelfes or cupboards.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel just outside de centre of...”
Reviews.Author: Biesje
Reviews.Content: Great hotel just outside de centre of Amsterdam. I can recomment having Ã  drink at the fireplace.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location with Spartan Rooms”
Reviews.Author: MandWS-MN
Reviews.Content: It is in a great location (easy walking distance to attractions) with a tram stop right across the street. The staff was very helpful and friendly and has a nice breakfast that is included in the room price. It has a nice lobby, however the rooms are very tiny (2 people cannot pass each other) and the walls/floor are very thin. You can hear people in the next room snoring. If you are in the new building be prepared for significant noise from the street and if you are in the old building be aware that there is no lift and a long, tight staircase to get your luggage to your room. .

Reviews.Title: “A liitle gem: very charming, very nice service, a hotel where you feel welcome!”
Reviews.Author: RoBuJu
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a little gem! Individual with a twist of design or boutique hotel with nice service provided and it has nothing of a boring chain hotel: Easy to find, as you don't have to drive through the inner parts of the city, yet central. Nice bars and restaurants around that area as well. I would recommend the ULIVETO traiteur at the corner of the second street on the left when you leave the hotel. Fresh Italian Trattoria Cuisine for lunch! Just 25 meters max. from the hotel. Mama can't cook any better :-) But back to the hotel: The entire !!! staff is very helpful, very friendly and very polite. This already makes the hotel different. The rooms are a bit dark, but modern and nice in a boutique or design hotel look-a-like style. Rooms are very quiet, lovely to sleep here. Rooms are small - but then do you really know any hotel with decent sized rooms in Amsterdam? I don't. What makes the hotel special is the Lounge. A mix of reception, buffet, bar and fire place. Large glaced facade and high ceiling gives light and much air to breeze. Clever dark curtain shields, so that pedestrians can't see you and won't disturb. The Lounge is really spacious and if you have to work, then here's a good place to work with your laptop on a nice landscaped sofa in front of a nice safe gas fireplace. Summarized: I would certainly book it again when in Amsterdam Recommended!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel- would stay again”
Reviews.Author: Chloebellsydney
Reviews.Content: This hotel was great, very friendly staff that went that extra mile with what ever you needed from a late night drink to hiring a bike at a cheaper rate than any other place in town. On arrival the information was excellent and very helpful during our stay. The lift is very cozy and two people are a squeeze but that was not a draw back at all. The room we booked was lovely it was on the upper floor (a small room) but had a lovely view looking over the roof tops of other properties and the bed was very comfy. The location is perfect, the center of town is a five minute tram ride which picks up and drops off from the front of the hotel and run late into the night. There is also a great little CafÃ© / Bar across the road encase you donâ€™t feel like going into town, it has good quality food and they also has an English menu. The hotel also had free internet and wifi and the breakfast had a wide selections to choice from. This hotel is modern and sheik and would recommend to anyoneâ€¦.

Reviews.Title: “I guess we were bad tourists as the room...”
Reviews.Author: C_and_MH
Reviews.Content: I guess we were bad tourists as the room we were given was in the basement. Yes, it's the first time I took the lift down to get to my room. The lobby is nice and service is friendly. Free wifi and tea/coffee. But don't get rooms with only one digit or you're going the dungeon.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, friendly staff, designed lobby and rooms and delicious breakfast!”
Reviews.Author: AdamTLV
Reviews.Content: The hotel staff were great, super friendly, graceful, kind and helpful. The breakfast was very good with a wide selection of food and drinks. The rooms are designed and comfortable, especially the beds and the shower. The hotel lobby is a nice and cosy place which you can spend sometime reading magazines and drinking coffee or tea which is free of charge for the hotel guests. The free wifi connection at the lobby and the rooms is great and not yet a standart in other hotels. The hotel has it's own city map with the best bars, caffes, restaurants and other hotspots which were all very successfull. Definitely will stay there again in my next visit!

Reviews.Title: “Stunning design hotel, small room but ticks every other box!!”
Reviews.Author: Loulou96
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel with my husband and two other friends, we were a little disappointed to be advised at check-in that we had been allocated a room in each of the hotels buildings given that we had booked the two rooms together some time ago. We booked this hotel having done some research on the location and on other peoples reviews and we were not at all disappointed. This hotel is beautifully designed and the reception/bar area is absolutely stunning. The hotel is located right next to the tram stop at Fredericksplein so it is very easy to get to the centre, it is also only a 10-15 minute walk to Dam Square and about a 10 minute walk to Rembrantplein depending which way you walk out of the hotel. As many of the reviews have stated the room sizes are very small. We booked standard rooms as we didnâ€™t plan on spending much time in the rooms, they are perfectly adequate if you have a small case or rucksack that slips under the bed, but if you have a large case you may have to sleep with it in the bed as there is very little floor space! The bathrooms were finished very nicely, with dark slate and pebble effect, our sink was in the room as the bathroom was too small, definitely not for the claustrophobic. The bed is one of the most comfortable I have slept in, had an amazing nightâ€™s sleep in it, comfortable pillows and lovely soft linen. The rooms do not have air-conditioning, but this was not a problem for us, despite the fine weather. The rooms have black out blinds, fans and the windows do open. As the hotel is so near to the tram stop you can hear the bells from the trams but this did not interrupt my sleep. My room was in the back building which does not have a lift and has incredibly steep stairs; the hallways are painted black and metallic silver and give a very nice effect if you like modern design. The front building does have a lift so I would recommend you request this building if you have any sort of mobility problems. The breakfast was absolutely lovely, served until 11 at the weekend and 10 during the week. It is served in the bar area where there are plenty of tables, we never had trouble finding somewhere to sit. It is a continental breakfast but a very good spread, croissants, bread, rolls, cheese, cold meat, preserves, soft cheese, peanut butter, chocolate spread, fruit, cereal, boiled eggs, juice, coffee & tea (and probably more that I canâ€™t recall!). We were going to breakfast at 10.30 and the spread was always extensive and fresh. A perfect breakfast to start the day, I cannot see how anyone could complain! The reception has a fantastic feel to it, just stunning design. No shortage of places to sit. You get free hot drinks from the bar during the stay which is a nice touch. There are also two Mac computers in the reception with free internet and the hotel has free WIFI which they will give you the log in at check in. You must visit the bathrooms on the ground floor under the reception, the wallpaper is amazing. The staff give you a great map at check in which is really handy for recommendations of places to go during your stay. I would recommend this hotel if you like modern design and donâ€™t intend on doing anything other than sleeping in your room. The style is fantastic, location perfect to get away from the hustle and bustle of the Dam, I will definitely return to the V hotel next time I am in the Dam.

Reviews.Title: “Boutique hotel with bulk quality”
Reviews.Author: JMal555
Reviews.Content: I was recommended this hotel by my local friend, who lived close by. The hotel looked very nice in their website and since the location was good, I booked it. Thou the lobby looks nice and designed, that's where it ends. Here's a quick rundown of the hotel: - There is no A/C in the hotel anywhere which is a problem when the temp goes above +24c (as it did during my stay). One window opened about 30cm, but there is a tram stop outside the hotel and the trams ring bells when approaching the stop, so it will wake you up. - My room (302) had a double bed, and abou 80cm space around it, nothing else. If you have 1 or 2 big suitcases, there's no other space to open them up except the bed, on which you obviously can't keep them throughout the night - The blackout blinds are positioned so, that sunlight will shine between straight to your face when you're lying on the bed. One of the blind was very difficult get all the way down, as someone talented decorator had installed a coat hanger so that it blocks partially the blind. - There is no minibar in the room, nor there is no ice maker on the hallway. You can get ice from the hotel bar, but only in a very small ashtray type of dish. Forget ice buckets. - TV has basic channels only (about 30), PayTV did not work, Info screen did not work - Hotel room door uses a traditional key, that you need to use when entering the room, inside the room if you want to lock the door (as you do) and when leaving the room. There is no autolock. - Door handle came off on my hotel room door - Bathroom is quite nice and modern, but very small, only about 80cm x 150cm and there's no space to put your toiletries besides a very narrow shelf (5cm x 20cm) - Modest continental breakfast; 2 types of rolls, 2 types of croissants, 2 types of cereal, 2 types of coldcuts, cheeses, coffee, tea, and warm orange juice and warm milk. Not worth paying for if you think about booking it separately. - Hotel is in 2 different buildings and to get to the back building you need to go outside through inner courtyard. The back building has very narrow and very steep staircase to the extend that I would not recommend this hotel to anyone with even slight mobility issues. The steps were about 15cm wide and 25cm high, so it would be dangerous with children, elderly or with even minor issues with balance, fear of heights or lifting feet.

Reviews.Title: “Can't decide if I liked my stay and if I would go back”
Reviews.Author: ColumbusCompass
Reviews.Content: Stayed in Hotel V for 2 nights in July. Mix of business and pleasure. Hotel V offers itself as a bit of a funky, modern hotel, which granted it was, however, I really canâ€™t make my mind up if I enjoyed my stay. One key point to make, this hotel is not for anyone wheel chair bound or has a walking disability. There are high and low steps into and out of the rooms and into the bathrooms, the stairs are steep and I ended up tripping up in my room. It is a very strange layout indeed. The positive side Off the main areas of Amsterdam, it was fairly quiet. I had a room in the basement, facing away from the road so no traffic noise for me and could not hear anyone. There is a tram stop right outside the hotel. There is free internet access with a couple of Apple Macâ€™s, you get free tea and coffee from the bar during your stay and there is a happy hour in the bar from 6-7pm. This is bottled beer but all half price at 3.50 Euros for a bottle of beer. Staff were friendly and could not fault them. The shower was excellent with a decent hairdryer and towels with complimentary soaps and shower gels. There was a TV in the room as well. All keys are handed into reception when you go out and collected from reception as well. The negative side No aircon in room, so room was warm. I had a basement room facing towards the back which was not too bad but my colleague had a room on the 1st floor and it was awful. The room itself was pretty small and dark, in fact, so dark, the safe that was situated on the floor in the corner was useless as I could not even see the numbers to use it, let alone, get on my hands and knees to use the thing anyway. Bed was very soft and the pillows were pretty dreadful. The high steps into and out of the room were a pain, and the steps leading down from the bar / breakfast area to your seats are not safe as yet again, after you descend, you step up and down for no apparent reason. The breakfast was average, cereals, boiled eggs, range of breads and hams. There is no real kitchen area as such so they are limited to what they can serve. The positive side is there is a good selection of teas and they can make you coffee straight from the bar using a decent machine. I really canâ€™t decide if I will stay again, I am due to go back to Amsterdam with work so will need access to hotels. The biggest benefit to me on this hotel is itâ€™s location away from the majority of noise. How to get there. From Schipol airport, take the train at a cost of 4.20 Euros for a single trip from either platform 1 or 2. The train takes 15-20 mins to arrive in Amsterdam Central. From there, you have three choices. Walk Will take approx 30 mins and is fairly easy to do, but, depends upon your luggage and the heat of the day etc. Tram. I took a tram from the hotel to the station at a cost of 2.60 Euros for a single trip. There are two trams, 4 or 25. I donâ€™t know if the same tram runs from the station to the stop at the hotel. It takes about 10 mins. If you have never used the tram before, you board at the back and you pay a ticket inspector as you board. Taxi Around 20 Euros for the trip. Note minimum cab fare in Amsterdam is 7.50 Euros.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, friendly staffs, comfortable bed...”
Reviews.Author: llng555
Reviews.Content: This was my first time to Amsterdam and traveling alone to a new city in a totally different language can be quite adventurous. I took the train from the airport to Centraal Station and hopped on the #25 tram which takes you directly to the front of the hotel. The hotel have rooms in different buildings and mine was in the back of the main building. I was assigned a room on the second floor and the girl told me there was no lift. My jaws dropped and she immediately asked if I would need help with the luggage. Luckily I was smart to store part of my luggage in the airport or else I would need to carry over 30kg. However, with the offer, I gladly accepted it. As I walked through the black corridor in the back building, I saw a narrow and steep staircase with a turnabout. I felt bad for the guy who was going to bring my luggage up. Opening the door to my room, I was literally 2 steps away from the wash basin and a step to the right was the bed. The room was small, but it did fit the queen size bed. I was looking for the bathroom to find a hidden door next to the wash basin. As I pull open the door, the toilet facing the wall was merely 8 inches away and the shower area was an elbow apart. If you are over 6'3, this would be a really uncomfortable toilet. If you are claustrophobic, you cannot survive the bathroom. Other than the size, it was clean. The room does not have any coffee/tea or water. The bar area in the lobby offers free coffee/tea throughout the day. The staffs there are all multi-talented. The guy who brought my luggage up was also the bartender and occasionally a receptionist. Amsterdam is definitely a city to be seen by foot. There's a supermarket 2 blocks away from the hotel. Two of the sightseeing attractions are 5 minutes away (Heineken Brewery and the Albert-cuypt Market. The reception can provide you with the map of Amsterdam with all the attractions to be seen/visited, so no need to purchase one from the tourist information counter at the airport for 4 Euros. My booking included buffet breakfast daily. The buffet offering are mainly continental breakfast with some cold-cuts and boiled egg at its max. Anything additional will be charged. However, i find their offering to be very fresh daily. So really, no need for the extras. On the day of my departure, the housekeeper assisted me with the luggage again and they stored it till whenever I needed to.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient location, friendly staff, good breakfasts”
Reviews.Author: Jaquesdor
Reviews.Content: Used Tripadvisor to find a decent hotel in Amsterdam and we weren't disappointed. Yes, the rooms are small but they are clean and well presented. With a great city like Amsterdam on your doorstep who wants to spend much time in a hotel room? The staff were all very helpful and friendly and seemed genuinely keen to make guests welcome at the hotel.
