Although the atmosphere is very relaxed, standards are high and the self service breakfast definitely sets you up for a day of exploring the canals and backwaters of this fascinating city.

Reviews.Title: “Stylish, comfortable and friendly service”
Reviews.Author: darney75
Reviews.Content: Hotel V offers stylish comfort and attentive service in an interesting location right on a tramline, about ten minutes ride to Dam Square. The guest lounge is particularly inviting with its open fireplace and relaxing ambience. We particularly enjoyed the generous buffet breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel - cold bathroom”
Reviews.Author: HowarDawn
Reviews.Content: The hotel was great and very handy for the tram. The staff were friendly helpful and the breakfast was hearty. I liked the atmosphere in the bar which was busy with passing trade as well as hotel guests. It was snowing the weekend that we were there which might have accounted for the temperature in the bathroom; but there was no radiator and we had to keep the door open in the hope that warm air might enter from the attic bedroom

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay, would stay there again”
Reviews.Author: pol125
Reviews.Content: Tram from outside Centraal Station takes only 10 mins....Great staff, always there to help/assist in any way to make your stay a pleasurable one. Had ordered champagne for our arrival, but did not receive it.(amended bill to suit) Room was of average size, but was listed as an XL room? Location was within a short walking distance from places of interest e.g. Museums. Would recommend the "Supper Club" experience, dining with a twist....With our room situated at the front of the building, the trams(if your not used to it) in the morning can be a bit noisy as they trundle past clanging their bells, suggest finding out location of room within building when contacting hotel. Great place to stay, would stay there again

Reviews.Title: “made to feel at home”
Reviews.Author: martinaCapeTown
Reviews.Content: The staff were very helpful . Breakfast was excellent , fresh roles , happy pig ( i was told the story ) Loved the free cappuccinos all day . Rooms small , especially as we were in a business trip , not much space to work ( did book a larger room from previous, but still tight ) Like the decore, good showers , towels could be larger but its a dutch thing ( I am dutch but live in Cape Town )

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel with convenient location and friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: ajvf97
Reviews.Content: I enjoyed my first time in Amsterdam as well as my stay at Hotel V. Upon arrival I was greeted and checked in promptly by Jan who epitomised the entire Hotel V staff; friendly, upbeat, efficient and informative. I was also given a very user friendly map of the city with all the sites/hot spots to see circled on it. That map was like a tourist's bible to me! Within minutes, my jet-lagged self was given a room key and I was in my room ready to take a little nap. The room itself is cozy. It is not large or spacious but what does that matter when I was out and about seeing the sites? I always had a fresh supply of towels, hot water and a good night's rest with little noise. My only complaints about the room were a desk lamp that didn't work and a small bathroom with a shower without a door/curtain meaning a wet bathroom floor after taking a shower. Breakfast was great and the lounge/dining area is very posh and inviting. Right outside the hotel entrance is a conveniently located tram stop. One moment you're finished with breakfast at the hotel and by the time you know it, you're at Central Station, Dam Square, a canal boat tour or wherever the eager Amsterdam traveler's heart desires. There are even eateries located within walking distance of the hotel which is in a safe location. Amsterdam is very manageable to get around and see. Hotel V and its staff exemplifies this friendly city. I would definitely want to stay here again and would recommend to friends or anyone traveling to Amsterdam.

Reviews.Title: “worst hotel ever!”
Reviews.Author: mj_hague
Reviews.Content: We stayed in hotel V in February and as very experienced travelers throughout the whole world, I can say as a dutch girl this was the worst! To pay 165 euro for a room smaller than my own bathroom, very noisy, we heard our neighbours having a great time..., you couldn't move in the bathroom, breakfast was just a cheap one. This is ok for an upgraded backpackers if you pay 75 euro but not 165!! The other thing, painting everything black does not mean it is design....

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel for couples or for friends who want to explore the city on Amsterdam.”
Reviews.Author: CruiserEST
Reviews.Content: The service in Hotel V is very good. Friendly staff. There was free Wifi in the hotel. I also really enjoyed the breakfast. The hotel is not very far from the center (we didn't even use any transportation ). About the rooms- the bed was very comfy and I slept there like baby. But the walls are too thin and when someone is flushing the toilet in the other room, you would know about it. The bathroom had tiled floor and it was very cold. So you couldn't go there without footgear. But everything else was great and if I visit Amsterdam again I would consider to use Hotel V's services next time also.

Reviews.Title: “Great value”
Reviews.Author: RubenLondon
Reviews.Content: For work i have to be in Amsterdam about twice a month and i have to say that it's hard to find a good hotel. You end up in a room that is a poor reflection of what you see on a website. I was pleasently suprised with Hotel V, finaly a Hotel that understand the needs of their guests. Friendly staff, a really good bed, nice bathroom, proper breakfast and a clean room. I think the location is perfect, quiet but still central. All together, a breath of fresh air after a year of bad experiences.

Reviews.Title: “Overall very good, some details can be improved. But definitely worth the money”
Reviews.Author: uselesstoy
Reviews.Content: A really stylish and comfortable hotel. Location is good enough to almost walk everything in the inner city of Amsterdam. Breakfast buffet was really delicious, the service young and very friendly. Details to improve: - Dust the rooms a little bit more often, black interior shows every minor dust (also on the nice balloon lamps) - Bath (very small) room was very cold as there was no heating at all. Maybe install an electro oven? - Champaign bottle and glasses (empty) where not tidied up with first room service, please be more precise

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service, supercool interiors and an overall great experience”
Reviews.Author: ParisLovesthecity
Reviews.Content: What makes this hotel outstanding is the service - the staff is exceptionally nice. Just to name an example, coffee in the Ã¼ber-stylish lounge area next to the reception is included. We had a friend come and pick us up from there, and because we were sitting there as hotel guests, he didn't pay anything for his coffee either! On our departure day, the room service staff helped me carry down our bags and were joking around in the process. People are generally friendly and in a good mood all the time. Our room was small but well kept, and the design was really cool. The location was perfect for exploring the town. Would definitely recommend this one and have done so quite a few times already!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect City Hotel”
Reviews.Author: BonViveurCork
Reviews.Content: Great hotel - perfectly located for exploring Amsterdam. Very comfy beds and nice simply appointed rooms and bathrooms. Cool lounge area. Nice staff.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent, I love this hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Talietskie
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel a few times for both business and leisure and I would recommend it for both. If you are on a budget but still want the nice designed room, rain shower etc. this hotel is perfect. You will have to live without the bellboy, roomservice and minibar but I think it's well worth the compromise for this price. Breakfast is continental only, but good and for lunch and dinner there are many restaurants in the area. Love the free Wifi and relaxing by the fireplace with a glass of wine. I am originally from Amsterdam so know many hotels in the city and have travelled a lot for work and can honestly say if you dont want to spend a lot of money but are used to a certain standard, Hotel V is the way to go!

Reviews.Title: “Too small to feel comfortable”
Reviews.Author: t_heinze
Reviews.Content: When I selected this hotel, I was impressed by their website and the nice looking interior. In reality I was disappointed: - although I booked a larger room it was quite small. Not to say tight. No heating in the bathroom, thin doors and fabulous street view. - on a short notice I was joined by a couple who booked also online but a smaller catergory, which is 50 Euros less. While they checked in they choosed a higher category and got, for only 10 Euros more, a much larger room than me under the roof. This was absolutely frustrating for me! Parking is very expensive! In the nearby garage I paid for 14 hrs 31 Euros. If you're there for a weekend you can even park your car in front of the hotel and pay the meter with your Maestro card. Costs the same. The lobby and the breakfast area are very nice. Apple computer for free. Location is central. Overall not really a business trip recommendation. Better for a student trip.

Reviews.Title: “Cool design but I would not recommend this hotel”
Reviews.Author: moonspoon
Reviews.Content: We got a room which had a horrible odour and a bath room which was ice cold (not heating). We also found socks in the rooms from previous guest. For such a new hotel, standard is low. Lobby is nice and service good. We believe there are better choices in Amsterdam.

Reviews.Title: “good as always”
Reviews.Author: martijnotten4
Reviews.Content: Hotel lies centrally near to all interesting site seeing locations like Museum, Heineken Experience etc. Hotek is very clean and beds are greatest. fireplace in the bar makes it nice and cosy to stay

Reviews.Title: “Amsterdam with love-totally true!!!”
Reviews.Author: sl_muenster
Reviews.Content: The hotel V in Amsterdam is the best hotel I have ever been. It is very close to the city center, the staff is very freindly and helpful! The rooms are very petty and stylish, The breakfast includes everything you need for a good start of the day. The room prices are absolutely adequate. All together we had a great time there!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel with friendly staff and value for money. What more to say?”
Reviews.Author: Alwaystravlin_66
Reviews.Content: I have stayed in Hotel V a number of times on business. First impressions are great from the moment you walk through the door. The reception and breakfast areas are relaxing and the staff extremely motovated and helpful. They recognise that you are a paying guest unlike some hotels I could mention. Rooms are sparse but comfortable, shower is always excellent. Occasionally noisy with late night revellers but not a major problem. Breakfast is always well presented and enjoyed in a relaxing atmosphere for a modern well thought out hotel. If I come here outside of business I would certainly look to stay here as it is on the main tram route (26 and 4) which stop outside so easy to get around. There are a number of restaurants in the area with a selection of Italian, Indian, Chinese general and bars that serve good food. Thumbs up from me.

Reviews.Title: “very stylish hotel with friendly and always smiling staff!”
Reviews.Author: Krivvll
Reviews.Content: Very good service Small but also very nice room, that was cleaned every day Location is not in the city centre, but in a silent place where it's possible to relax after long walks Helpful staff Stylish cups for coffee!

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel”
Reviews.Author: quicksand11
Reviews.Content: I was pleased with the hotel overall, a decent walk one of the main centres, but not too far - about 20 mins. Rooms are quite small in general so you should go for the biggest if you value space. Also, the rooms as a result don't come with a wardrobe which was a little odd, Also, we had to walk up some very precarious stairs to get to our room, so steep. But again maybe alot of places in Amsterdam are like that as I've not been before. We changed our room twice - first time because my girlfriend wanted a double bed instead of a twin (accused me of doing it on purpose, again), so we had to move, and then the next room stank of sewer, so we moved again. The staff were quite accommodating though in general, i don't usually like to make too much fuss, so my girlfriend sorted it out for us. Breakfast was abundant and staff nice. free tea and coffee downstairs. v. trendy hotel - there's a massive golden British bulldog statue when you go in which says it all. Overall 8 / 10

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Stay”
Reviews.Author: Bassel73Beirut
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Hotel V in march 2010, a design hotel, it was a fantastic experience. The staff is incredibly nice, friendly and professional. The hotel itself is a newly designed one with a beautiful chimney at the lobby adding a charming cozy atmosphere. But the best of all is the bed.... absolutely perfect, fluffy and comfortable. Free wifi is available in the rooms and the lobby. The only negative points are: Bathroom too small, the rooms that gives on the main road are a bit noisy (because of the tram rails nearby).

Reviews.Title: “trendy spot with super comfy beds”
Reviews.Author: joyfulfortress
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Hotel V in March 2010. I wanted to stay in a reasonably priced place that was also fun and trendy, and this was a good pick. I was very happy with my room, and my bed was amazinging comfortable. The included breakfast in the morning was substantial and by far the best hotel breakfast I have had in Europe. Wifi is available in the rooms and several computers were also provided for internet access free of charge. Getting to and from the train station and to other parts of town was no problem. Whenever I had a question the hotel staff were very helpful and accomodating. I would definintely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Worth for the purpose of my trip to Amesterdam”
Reviews.Author: SoniaJesus
Reviews.Content: The hotel location was just perfect for me as the tram stop was in front of the hotel and I needed to go to RAI Centre. And it's also mid way to Amsterdam centre. The hotel staff were very friendly. What I really didn't like was the fact that my room was in another building, just behind but I have to carry my luggage outside, alone and went up the stairs, as there was no lift on it. One other thing was the fact that one of the windows of my room, didn't close properly so I could feel the cold and wind getting into the room. I've put some towels on the window and on the following day I went to the reception to inform of this problem. The boy was friendly but the only thing he did was do the same as I have done the night before. Put more towels on the window with adhesive tape.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, full of friendly staff who...”
Reviews.Author: olivercarding
Reviews.Content: Great hotel, full of friendly staff who couldn't do enough to make the stay memorable. The locations perfect and the room was one of the cleanest I've ever stayed in.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing hotel at a reasonable price!”
Reviews.Author: odedd
Reviews.Content: The hotel was simply amazing. Very high profile, sleek decor. The room (V-Twin) was very small, but looked great and was kept to incredibly high standards (I wanted to take the bed home, but it wouldn't fit my suitcase). It's probably a very (very) good hotel if you're traveling with friends or a couple. Not very suitable for a family in my opinion. The staff were very friendly and responsive, and gave us great tips for touring the city. The location is also great - it's not at the heart of all the fuss, but fairly close (10 min. walk from leidseplein and 15 min. walk from the dam), and when there's good weather it's a fun walk, otherwise, there's a tram right in front of the hotel. With free-wifi I was able to keep working the little bit of work that I had (there are also two computers (iMacs) available for guests). Plus - we got a great deal, for coming in a low-ish season, so we're extremely happy with that hotel, and would gladly recommend it to anyone seeking for accommodation in amsterdam.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel although Mix up with Booking which was ENTIRELY hotels fault”
Reviews.Author: Kirban
Reviews.Content: The Hotel itself was great. Nice location and awesome look, especially liked the fireplace and bar area. What I didn't like was being put in a smaller room than we had booked due to them thinking we wanted a double room when infact we wanted twin (I do like the mate I was travelling with but not really in the way that would see us sharing a bed :-). They had no normal twin share rooms available so in the end gave us a smaller room but obviously no refund in price. They told me I was at fault for booking Double room and only after much discussion did I finally produce the print out I had from them saying I had booked Twin room.... Other than that if you can get the right room then I really liked this hotel. Cheers K

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay at !”
Reviews.Author: marissima
Reviews.Content: We had a great time at the hotel, the staff is very nice and friendly, and the hotel itself is really nice and decorated with style. The only little thing we were not so happy about was the "european gap" of the beds. We'd have prefered a large bed, rather than two separated bed put next one to the other. But aart from that, the beds were just great.

Reviews.Title: “Tiny rooms, poor customer service not that central”
Reviews.Author: Damohop
Reviews.Content: Booked hotel as looked cool and assumed it was central based on conversation with reservations. We booked two single room and a standard double. The standard double was tiny couldnt walk around bed and was up a very steep dangerous flight of stairs which was difficult with luggage (no-one to help with luggage). Immediately upgraded myself and my staff to larger rooms which were a better size although bathrooms very small very dark and very very cold, even the hairdryer blew cold air!! One of the rooms we had also had a strong smell of smoking. Returned to hotel after dinner just after midnight to have a drink by the smart looking fireplace to be told bar closed and no drinks available not even soft drinks, also couldnt get a drink in room as no room service and no minibars in room!! Breakfast also disapponting restaurant area dirty untidy no hot food and no english breakfast tea. Staff were not that friendly and not that helpful either. As a business we travel to amsterdam frequently but this was the first and last time we will stay at V which I assume stands for Very disappointing.

Reviews.Title: “A charming multi-cultural welcome in mulit-cultural Amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: heikeph
Reviews.Content: Hotel V is unique with its elegant African flair. The open fire in the lounge is a real magnet and it attracts guests from morning to late. This way it is easy to get into contact with other visitors. Hotel V (V is not five, but 'vii') is run by a mixture of nationalities, all together Amsterdam lovers according to Jan, the manager. I particularily enjoyed meeting the legend Frankie, a gentle African giant with a huge and apparently real black belt. Overall this hotel left a deep impression of imagination and hospitality in beautiful but rainy Amsterdam with the warmth and sunny smile of Africa.

Reviews.Title: “Elegant, amazing, modern, cozy hotel with really kind staff”
Reviews.Author: SBRSAB
Reviews.Content: We spent three nights in Hotel V, it was our fifth time in Amsterdam, and it is definetely the best Hotel where we have stayed in. Room was really warm, stylish and confortable; the lobby makes you feel home, with the big discrete windows, the calid chimenee, and the huge sofa, were you could spend hours having a free tea or cofee while reading some magazines or talking with some other clients or the nice people who works there. The location is ideal, just going outside you reach in ten minutes walking any interesting place and just in face of the hotel there are 3 or 4 trams connecting you with all the city and there is a taxi stop as well, but do not forget taking a bycicle! In the neighbourhood you will find many nice restaurants and local people. Best choice to go for pleasure or business and enjoy Amsterdam! 100% recommendable!

Reviews.Title: “a very nice modern hotel, but very small rooms!”
Reviews.Author: charliees
Reviews.Content: It's a very nice modern hotel but be prepared that the rooms will be quite small.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay, great breakfast!”
Reviews.Author: Louise Wallace
Reviews.Content: 3 friends and I stayed at Hotel V to celebrate one of our birthdays. Wonderful place to stay, stylish and fresh. Rooms are clean and the beds are a dream to sleep on. Great breakfast, good selection of items to choose from, certainly did not leave hungry!! Would recomend this hotel to anyone who is looking for a quirky hotel in Amsterdam with bags of charm and character

Reviews.Title: “great hotel for family with young teenagers”
Reviews.Author: lily062
Reviews.Content: Never written a review before but have so say our children loved this hotel. I chose very carefully as I did not want an old fashioned hotel as I have a very cool 14 year old boy and an equally cool 11 year old daughter. They loved it. Mostly the apple computers in the reception, the fact that the staff were young, the modern decor, and the general ambience of the place. Have to say the most comfortable beds ever. Also found the de Piip area had great ethnic food within walking distance for the evenings.

Reviews.Title: “chic, but you'll end up at the wrong address and even worse...”
Reviews.Author: cbbprovidenciales
Reviews.Content: The rooms were very clean, the beds were comfortable, and the staff was very friendly. But if your stay involves needing anything more than that, I would not recommend this hotel. For all the chicness and professionalism that this hotel boasts, it's nothing more than a facade. Where do I begin: when we asked for directions, the hostess marked it incorrectly on the map, which caused us to bicker with the cab driver who insisted we had to pay more for getting lost. when we made it very clear that we had to have our dresses and suit for our wedding from the dry cleaners back on the same day and they said the dry cleaning comes back same day, they didn't have it until the next morning, which caused concern since we had to leave for the ceremony at 930am. When a dress strap needed to be taken in, it came back from the dry cleaners/tailor shortened, but twisted. When they charged my credit card twice, and I called them up to clear up the mistake, they told me they didn't have any record of it. They were looking it up based on the amount and not by the name on the card. Conclusion: This hotel is not worth the money one spends on a room. If you're going to spend this amount on a room, it should come with professional service not a headache. The staff should be trained to be specific and professional, and as you can clearly see they are completely unprofessional when you need anything outside of basic. It starts with poor communication and service from the staff trickling to whoever is doing their cleaning/tailoring. Maybe this was all bad timing and luck for their staff and perhaps what we were asking is not considered basic, but then one could argue that getting your suit cleaned the same day or as promised is a basic service whether for business or a wedding.

Reviews.Title: “loved it”
Reviews.Author: travlermd
Reviews.Content: The hotel V had a wonderful and very helpful staff. They were very informative. The hotel is in a conveniently located with a tram stop right in front of the hotel. I never used the tram the entire week I was there, my husband and I walked everywhere. It only took at most 25-30min to walk to the far end of the city from the hotel. Breakfast was wonderful, it was a spread of cheese, meats, various breads and croissants, cereals and some fruit. The hotel has free tea and coffee all day in the lobby which was nice to have tea and sit in front of the fire. The only draw back was the size of the room and bathroom, it is very small.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: amanda_aust
Reviews.Content: It was a great place to say. The free Wi-Fi was easy to set up and fast (there are also 2 mac you can use). As a note ask to say NOT on the side of the street; The trams go till about midnight and there was a rather loud couple arguing on the streets one night. The lift is very small. The room was clean and had everything we needed. Its a fun place to stay and easy to catch a 4 or 25 tram into the city centre. Happy hour 1/2 price drinks is always a bonus next to the fire at the end of the day.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome staff and a great stay”
Reviews.Author: k_i_dMN
Reviews.Content: Hotel V was very accommodating to our group. Friendly, knowledgeable staff. Great breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Cozy Staff Makes You Feel Like Home”
Reviews.Author: hotelsucks
Reviews.Content: Cool place to stay for the young hipsters among you. Old and stuffy do not apply, as you will not be happy with the room quality. To sum them up, they are small and oddly designed, yet with comfy, small, new beds. But who the heck is going to be in the room in Amsterdam? Get to it, this is the coolest staff around!

Reviews.Title: “beautiful room, beautiful breakfast, very accomedating and friendly staff.”
Reviews.Author: paintedfeet
Reviews.Content: I found this hotel to be charming in its atmosphere and staff, the room was very comfortable and although a bit out of the way, kind of nice in that it wasn't in the super touristy district. nice to wander and discover the outskirts of Amsterdam as well. Plus, breakfast was lovely, and the coffee to die for!!! Thanks again for a very lovely stay.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel V has great style!”
Reviews.Author: Erynstar25
Reviews.Content: Hotel V has a very cool, modern style. The rooms are a little small, but I assume everywhere in Amsterdam is. The hotel is newly remodeled and therefore very clean and stylized. The offer free breakfast and internet and were very helpful with giving directions. I would definitely stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: JuliaLovesEurope
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed for 2 nights, Sept 1 & 2nd. We had a superior double room on the top floor. Very comfortable bed and nice linens. Huge bathroom and lots of room in the shower. Yes the rooms are on the smaller side, but in Holland you'll be hard pressed to find massive rooms anywhere! Plus we were only there to sleep and shower, so it made no difference to us. My only complaint is about the mess the shower made in our bathroom. By the time the both of us had showers, the floor was covered in water. We tried our best to mop it up but the cleaning staff was nice enough to leave an extra towel for the next day. On our second day we didn't have hot water in the morning, so our showers were quick! I loved the location, it was in walking distance of everything and has a very convenient tram stop right outside. Directions to get to the hotel from Centraal station were very clear and it only took about 10 mins. on the tram. When we arrived we actually met one of the proprietors, he was very very nice and told us where to go for good food, and for less expensive meals. When we came back from eating at a very good restuarnt, we talked about making iphone apps! On the morning of or departure they called a cab for us and even let us take a few things for breakfast even though it wasn't the serving time yet. I liked the elevator, it was very different than the huge ones in North America! It was nice not to have to take our luggage up all the stairs, but the elevator does not go right to the top, so if you have a room on the 3rd floor, there is a quick set of stairs which is easily manageable. All in all good service and a lovely stay. Would definitely return and recommend to friends and family.

Reviews.Title: “Micro-hotel room, no A/C, unstable fan, 3 bugs and a bee in the room”
Reviews.Author: 4pcavtravels
Reviews.Content: They advertise as being HIP and I wouldn't disagree. Black painted interiors, up to date and modern finishes in the bathrooms but the size of the standard double room was ridiculous!! You could barely get around the bed. If you dared to bring a suitcase you had to get on the bed to get past it. (and I am not a big woman - 5'5" and 121 pounds) In order to look in the full link mirror you had to stand at the foot of the bed with one knee on the bed. It is difficult to determine how you look when you only can see one half of yourself. The mirror in the bathroom was placed so high I could only see my face and hair from the cheekbones up. But the absolutely worst was the lack of air-conditioning and a faulty fan. Leaving the windows open also invited pesky flying things and noise. All of this for 109 Euros/night! Should have been 39euros.night!

Reviews.Title: “Luxury and 5 star service at an excellent price”
Reviews.Author: BarnsleyJetsetter
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the V for the weekend of my wedding anniversary with my hubby and we both loved it. Like an idiot I put all my spending money in my savings account and got to Holland unable to access the money but the staff were great. We called my dad (can't live with them, cant live without them) and they let him pay with his card and gave me the cash which saved the weekend. The decor was ultra modern. It was all black which made us happy cos all our house is black and we always get the micky taken out of us for it. Even the toilet roll was black! The bed was really bouncy and comfy and it had a big shower so we could both fit in! Everything you need for a great trip to the dam! The food was nice and breakfast was very civilised. We did a lot of walking and sight seeing and we weren't really in a fit state when we returned to the hotel each evening so it was great not to have to worry about a thing once we got to the hotel. Will definately go back.

Reviews.Title: “The best wee hotel in Amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: selbelxxx
Reviews.Content: Me and my boyfriend stayed in Hotel V for 4 nights last week and loved it. It seemed like such a perfect place to stay when in the beautiful city of Amsterdam. We wanted to give a shout out to the lovely Jan who was so welcoming, friendly and helpful throughout our stay, we got a map of the city when we checked in and Jan told us all the nice places to visit which was great! I really enjoyed the breakfast at the hotel. i didn't think I would coz its the continental breakfasts, but the selection was good and the coffee and chocolate croissants were great! I loved the location because it wasn't right in the middle of the city centre so you get to stroll past the lovely canals on your way back n forth, which you could miss out on if you stayed in the centre. Although the hotel always seemed to be a 5/10 min walk from everything which was handy. The hotel was always clean n tidy, very modern inside. The lift always made me laugh because of how small it was, our room was a good size (we went for the superior double which i think is a medium sized room) and that was fine. All n all I would definately recommend staying at the Hotel V because of the great atmosphere, funky decor and great location... and of course the lovely staff who were always friendly and chatty. Can't wait to go back:)

Reviews.Title: “Hotel V - Oozes character and cool :D”
Reviews.Author: MrOmnibug
Reviews.Content: Been staying in Hotel V quite a while now! What a perfect place to be to enjoy Amsterdam. Expect to be greeted by the most renowned Mr Jan as you enter, seemingly legendary character with wizard like knowlodge of the city. Most of the staff are equally clued up for all great places in town especially if you get the service of Sabine, Suzanna or Sophie's company at the bar, definitely the hottest & most friendly hotel staff I've ever met! There is free wifi basically everywhere and included buffet breakfast which seems to be a real rarity in Amsterdam. Breakfast is of a continental type, nice croissants, cheese n meats etc, does miss out on english hot breakfast like poached/fried egg, bacon but I guess that isnt Dutch. Hotel is very arty, the rooms are very comfee, got the flatscreen tv's and 8" shower rose in the bathroom which is great as long as you don't mind getting your hair wet, i.e Man Shower :D Room size & noise are contentious issues... i.e if you book a large room translates to a medium and a small means micro size. Be careful to avoid the basement and the street side rooms if you like a quiet night, Dutch rules on windows make double glazing a no no. Location is about perfect if you like being close to the nightlife in town but far enough away that it a bit quieter. Loads of excellent bars and great places to eat around the Pijp area, about 12mins walk into the heart of town at stumbling pace :p or 4 mins if you go all Dutch with the rent-a-bike thing Overall hotel V is a fantastic place to crash out, especially for couples or those arty types.... on the other hand, being there on business was fun as well :) Most importantly the staff really make the place truly great, the decor just compliments . I would stay here anytime :)

Reviews.Title: “Simple, clean, and perfect!”
Reviews.Author: thefidget
Reviews.Content: I only stayed for one night. Check in was easy. Breakfast was lovely. The room was gorgeous with a window (4th floor). Warning: the lift is teeny tiny, but the stairs are spacious if you have big luggage. I will definitely go back when I have more time. I fully recommend renting one of their bikes and cruising the city. What a blast!

Reviews.Title: “Hotel V - good location, standard hotel”
Reviews.Author: Aethel
Reviews.Content: We just came home from a 3 nights stay at Hotel V in Amsterdam. We picked this hotel because of the great reviews and because of the location. Right next to the tram line and in walking distance (15 min) from Rembrandtplein. We booked a large room, but it was still very small. However we only slept in the room so it didnt matter so much. We also chosed Hotel V because they had wireless internet in the whole hotel. Unfortunately this didnt work on my comp apparently. And the problem never got solved. The breakfast was very boring with a sloppy look. Overcooked eggs. Dry bread, and cheese. The coffee aswell as the juice was ok. Just too sad that the staff not always bothered refilling it. But okay Dutch breakfast tends to be boring ....they could learn from the Germans ;) The Staff seemed very into surfing the net. I think they got a competition going on. They werent unfriendly just uninterested. The last night friday 3rd of july. We managed to buy a drink in the bar it was 23.00 at that point. After 45 min. we got told to go to our room ?? there were no explanation. Just the big janitory looking fellow saying " Guys could you please go to your rooms soon" We never found out why we werent allowed to sit in the lobby it wasnt 0.00 yet. But I suggest to buy your drink somewhere else than at the hotel I didnt dislike the hotel but I didnt like it either. If you can live without the posh decorating and the Ikea look alike bathroom. Theres better value for your money elsewhere

Reviews.Title: “Cute boutique hotel in great area, but be sure to choose your room wisely”
Reviews.Author: TravelinShane
Reviews.Content: Its a great trendy hotel, in a great location. However under NO circumstances do you want to stay in the rooms in the basement (rooms 6 through 9). They are underneath the restaurant and so you hear people walking above you all morning starting at 6:30am. And they are below the bar and across from the public restrooms so you hear people partying all night. And to top it off, the rooms are next to the maids quarters... so you hear doors slamming all day. And finally they are dark... one small sad window. And no AC. However, if you dont care about AC and can get one of the rooms that are above the restaurant/bar or behind it (they have rooms behind the building too), then I recommend this hotel. But if they try to put you in the basement rooms, run away screaming!!! They also have a small breakfast buffet. Just avg, but it does the trick. And they have free internet too. Nice plus.

Reviews.Title: “V made my stay in Amsterdam perfect”
Reviews.Author: tiger_lilly9
Reviews.Content: I spent 3 nights in hotel V Frederiksplein and it made a good impression on me. It is located almost in the city center close to some of the major Amsterdam atractions (in the walking distance + tram stop just in front of the hotel). Hotel V itself is very clean, friendly and trendy place for people who do not like chain hotels on one side or dirty hostels on the other. I loved the lounge area as well as the delicious breakfast and very comfy bed. Room as well as bathroom are little, but have everything you might need for comfortable stay. Our room was located to the yard so it was quiet. Most flattering is the individual and friendly approach of the hotel staff . Small gestures such as welcome drinks, free cofee and tea during the day make it big in the V hotel

Reviews.Title: “Looks nice but very noisy”
Reviews.Author: Kas_Sweden
Reviews.Content: The hotel is reasonably trendy, clean rooms, a friendly staff and well positioned for travel in the city (tram and subway nearby). But unfortunately it is located opposite a very noisy tram stop. Because the windows are poorly insulated, one even hears the trams use their horns until around 1 AM even on the backside of the hotel. Trams start again around 6 AM. Even inside rooms are noisy and one hears other visitors from rooms above oneself.

Reviews.Title: “Happy Days!”
Reviews.Author: EggUK
Reviews.Content: Great hotel in a good location, within a short walking distance (or a hop on the metro) of all the action but quiet enough to get a decent night's sleep! Really friendly and helpful staff, together with some good background tunes, made for a relaxed atmosphere in the reception area. The rooms aren't huge - but big enough and, lets face it, with such a great reception area and funky decor throughout the hotel you won't want to stay in your room for long anyway - a visit to the downstairs toilets for the great wallpaper and flooring alone is a must! The rose tea is lovely at breakfast too! And, finally, don't forget to feed the dog minding the entrance - he loved it!!

Reviews.Title: “Friendly staff make it a good choice!”
Reviews.Author: alih68
Reviews.Content: Stayed in Hotel V Frederiksplein for 3 nights at the end of March. We were on the fourth floor of the main building, the lift only goes to the third floor, so be prepared if you have a heavy case. First impression was that the hotel was extremely modern and trendy, the staff were all lovely and were always smiling and ready to answer any questions in a friendly manner, which I find quite unusual in Europe these days. Our room was quite small but adequate, and the bathroom was nearly as bit as the bedroom and everything was spotlessly clean. I'm glad we were on the top floor as it was quiet enough, as I heard others complaining about the noise. Free tea and coffee all day is a great added bonus as coffee in Amsterdam sets you back about â‚¬4 so this, and the free wifi was a nice touch.Breakfast was continental and a mix of cereal, rolls, cold meats, cheese and fruit. Anyone concerned that they are out of town need not be, there are two tram stops outside the hotel which take you to Dam square or Leidseplein in about five minutes. We bought a 72 hour tram ticket for â‚¬15 at the tourist information across from central station, this was great value and can be used on the buses all night which is a great saving as taxis are very expensive. Not to be missed are Anne Franks House and the Verzetsmuseum(Dutch Resistance Museum) which is not on the tourist maps but is right next to the zoo. Amsterdam is a lovely city, and when I return I will definitely stay at the friendly Hotel V Frederiksplein again.

Reviews.Title: “These guys have done their homework”
Reviews.Author: IndianN01
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at Hotel V for three nights last months. The hotel is situated close to a really cool shopping street, Utrechtsestraat, which has cute boutiques and lunch rooms. The staff at the reception gave me good advise where to shop, have dinner => Supperclub- what a place! - and they even offered to put me on the guest list of a club if I wanted. For anyone going to Amsterdam, this place gives good value for money. The staff is attentive and I really look forward to come back here.

Reviews.Title: “Very youth hostel-ish”
Reviews.Author: landsahoy
Reviews.Content: From the site I thought this would be a nice boutique-style hotel, but on arrival in our teeny tiny room I couldn't help but think it was really just a youth hostel with some black Ikea furniture. The room was silly small - there was no space for luggage and the lighting was so bad that when I did find space to put my bag I couldn't find it in the dark. It was also very noisy - the walls were very thin and we were constantly woken during the night.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic few days at the Frederiksplein”
Reviews.Author: justinboots
Reviews.Content: We have stayed in Amsterdam several times and have always found the hotel we have chosen to be rather cramped and uninteresting so we decided that for our September trip we would take a closer look at what was available on the internet. We looked at lots of hotels and then noticed the hotel V frederiksplein which looked totally different to what we were used to so we booked for a few days. When we arrived we were very impressed with what we found. It has a very attractive large reception/bar/sitting area which is something we found lots of Amsterdam hotels lacked. The reception staff were very helpful and our room was fantastic we had already read about the individual decor and were very impressed. The bed was huge, high up and really comfortable again a first for us in Amsterdam where they are usually very ordinary. Right infront of us was a flat screen tv which again was really great to have. The furniture was attractive and functional and the bathroom and shower really well appointed. The choice for breakfast was amazing and really good as again we have found most Amsterdam hotels only offer very basic breakfast. The bar staff were really friendly and chatty and it was great for a relaxing drink after a day walking around the city. On the day we checked out we were really short of time to get to the station and the reception staff found us a taxi really fast and we managed to get catch our train with time to spare. We are intending to visit Amsterdam in March 2009 and will be back to the hotel V frederiksplein for a few days. Iain & Barry

Reviews.Title: “Top hotel in Amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: gmellon1
Reviews.Content: Arrived in Holland after an 11 hour flight ready to fall asleep at the train station. Arrived at the Hotel V Frederiksplein with no trouble at all and found my room ready to go and the staff ready to help. The most friendly staff I have ever met in Amsterdam and the rooms are even better. The room was comfortable and modern helping me to relax during my time in Amsterdam. I recommend this hotel to anyone Dutch or Foreign enjoying a stay in Amsterdam!

Reviews.Title: “Style, comfort and location: a night in Hotel V Frederiksplein”
Reviews.Author: WSP_9
Reviews.Content: I live nearby Amsterdam and had decided to take my girlfriend to the ballet as a surprise. So I also sought a nice stylish and friendly hotel conveniently located in the centre of town. A friend of mine referred me to Hotel V, so I booked a room. Check-in was quick and friendly, room wasn't very big but more than made up for it by the interior. I'm not a style guru, but I do really enjoy staying in freshly designed and stylishly decorated hotel rooms. This was exactly what I found. There was a very nice (too nice for the early wake-up due to work) king-size bed and one of those 'rain' showers in the bathroom. Downstairs in the lobby there's a very cosy lounge area with a big circular sofa around a cosy fireplace. Coffee (good italian brew), tea and internet complimentary. From the hotel a 5 minute walk took us to the Stopera (opera hall) near Rembrandt Square, by walking through the Utrechtsestraat (street in Amsterdam with heaps of nice restaurants). We enjoyed the ballet and walked back to the hotel, stopping for a 'kroket' on Rembrandt Square and a good whiskey in the Utrechtstestraat on the way back. Next morning we enjoyed the generous breakfast buffet and then unfortunately left for work. But definitely a place to recommend, and I will definitely come back more! Thanks Hotel V.

Reviews.Title: “just very good situated”
Reviews.Author: Misterycouple
Reviews.Content: Date: december 11, 2008 Reviewer: A TripAdvisor Member, Roosendaal We have just returned from 2 days at the Hotel V frederiksplein Amsterdam. The hotel is magnificent and we have never experienced such incredible service before. It was so lovely that it was hard to drag ourselves away from the hotel to go to the city at all. It was so cold and busy there, we couldn't wait to get back to the peace and tranquility of the hotel. We stayed on the secondflore room 308. The room was nice romantic but not spacious. Breakfast was very lovely and you can get coffee,thea and fruit the whole day for free. The music is great and they have a nice fireplace where infront you can lounge and see the fabulous life of Amsterdam. We paid â‚¬99 per night for a room incl. breakfast which we thought excellent value if you want to mix a little luxury with the possible trips then this is an absolute must Overall I would say this is probably the best hotel we have ever stayed in on holiday and I am extremely fussy!

Reviews.Title: “Could have been perfect!”
Reviews.Author: luijo100
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a sample of what you can do right with a hotel... it is almost perfect in style, friendliness, and even location (although it is on the outskirts of what you would consider the pure center)... if it weren't for the size of the rooms it would be one of the best I've stayed in... It is true about the basement rooms, where you can touch the grass outside if you put your hand out of the high window... The rooms are really cool-looking modern style but matchbox sized, the toilet is surprisingly decent sized and not worse decorated than the room and the beds are very comfortable. Breakfast is just average, bread, snacks, fruit... nothing really special about it... Business services are great! you get free internet, a wi-fi connection that actually works (and fast) plus you get a free drink and free coffee and tea. Overall it was a great experience!

Reviews.Title: “Good but not great”
Reviews.Author: MulliReykjavik
Reviews.Content: A good but not a great hotel. The good: - clean - good location - friendly staff Average: - The breakfast The not so good (though not really bad): - Small room - The room was cold when I checked in but then I turned the heating on. It worked out well. - No bedside table

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location / Friendly Staff / Great Time”
Reviews.Author: Grushenka
Reviews.Content: After arriving at central station it was short tram ride to the hotel. It is in a great location to explore the city with all the main attractions a walkable distance (or just grab a tram pass if you want). The hotel staff were all really friendly and gave us some great tips on where to eat and go out- invaluable local knowlege to keep you out of the tourist traps! The rooms are compact but perfectly acceptable and very well designed with an amazing rain water shower. We were treated to a free drink at the bar on arrival and complimentary tea and coffee / internet throughout. Plus tyhe breakfasts were fab. I will definitely be returning to the Frederiksplein on my next trip to 'dam.

Reviews.Title: “Not worth the money”
Reviews.Author: Hollandtraveller
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Hotel V in October 2008 during a weekend trip to Amsterdam. I had read the reviews on Tripadvisor and it sounded like a decent hotel. I was, however, disappointed by the hotel and do not recommend it. I booked a single room for 79 euros, which plus tax really costs 83 euros. While the hotel has a nicely decorate lobby-restaurant area, my room was located in the basement of a building behind the main building. The room was tiny, had no more furniture than a bed and a little side table, and had no windows. The sheets of the bed were dirty, so I had to ask the reception to get them changed. The building is very old, so one can hear everything from the other rooms and the floor above. The positive things of this hotel: it is centrally located, at walking distance from most sites, with several tram stops right across the street; internet is free and breakfast is included, although it's not great. The girl at the reception was very nice. If you decide to stay here, it is worth paying a bit more for a decent room. There are better options in Amsterdam. Hotel Piet Hein is nearby and is a nicer hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome hotel, funky & amazing service”
Reviews.Author: scoot6
Reviews.Content: This hotel's service is truly unique and stands above the rest. I travel about 40% of the time for my job & this hotel is the best one I have stayed in for the past three years from a customer service perspective. Objectively, the rooms are small, but who cares as the room was neat, clean, bed was big, comfortable, shower was great & it had everything I needed. More importantly the staff guided me around Amsterdam after work hours to make my stay truly memorable. They have bikes to rent (suggested), free coffees, a free drink when you arrive, a funky bar area, free Mac internet access. Wow. This place truly sets the bar high for others to match - I have already emailed my network to say this is the place when in Amsterdam & it is a GREAT VALUE!

Reviews.Title: “Falling below advertised image”
Reviews.Author: junzi
Reviews.Content: We booked our stay via the hotel's website and then had to change our date. When we arrived the booking had not been made. Fortunately, there were still free rooms available. The weather was cold but there was no heating in the bathroom. The shower, on the other hand, was broken so that one could not use it without scalding oneself. The friendly girl at reception apologised but that was that â€¦ Overall impression: great location but painting everything black does not make a boutique hotel

Reviews.Title: “Anniversary in A'Dam”
Reviews.Author: adsgflakkdnhngldakfj
Reviews.Content: Found Hotel V through Splendia hotels website. Emailed the hotel to tell them it was our wedding aniversary, got a reply within the hour saying that their concierge would contact me by phone - what service. Marlon (concierge) was very helpful, making suggestions to fit around what we liked. We went to the Supperclub and had the best seat/bed in the restaurant/club. We recommend the Supperclub though save up a little before going, the bill might take the edge off the perfect evening - its pricey. Hotel V (Frederiksplein) was great. We had a small double room, stylishly done, it was small but I chose it because Amsterdam has so much to see and do that you only need a comfortable bed and a good shower to put your head down. The staff were all very friendly. The service was good, the free tea and coffee and internet all add to the vibe. The styling of the hotel lounge / bar / dining room is great too....the crescent sofa around the fireplace was our favourite very funky. I didnt want to spend a great deal on accomodation in A'dam and was very pleasantly surprised at the standard of service we found for our pound (buck / euro / etc). I'd like to recommend it but we dont want it to fill up with package tourists stopping us going and pushing prices up, so don't go to Hotel V its ours !!!! Thanks to all the staff there especially Marlon (next time JWoo for sure). Guy n Di x

Reviews.Title: “nothing but love for hotel V!”
Reviews.Author: organicphotographer
Reviews.Content: this was my first time staying at the frederiksplein hotel and it was amazing. the actual hotel is beautiful, obvious that a lot of thought and creativity went into the design. the staff is friendly and helpful and the location is ideal - close to everything. i've stayed at the other hotel V twice and was pleasantly surprised that my favorite things about this brand are intact...free wi-fi, fantastic music, great style and the best breakfast in europe, seriously! cannot say enough nice things about this hotel and the staff that run it, it's like a home away from home.

Reviews.Title: “NIce hotel”
Reviews.Author: richeyint
Reviews.Content: Hotel is not expensive. Rooms are very very small but comfortable. Lighting is not a +. Nice to have free internet. CI was not very efficient. I asked if there was internet in the room. Agent confirmedand could hve givenme the code straight away avoiding me calling the front desk (line was busy for a long period). When you have a shower the WC gets all wet. Did not try breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely stay at V..”
Reviews.Author: clootje
Reviews.Content: we arrived in the afternoon at hotel V Frederiksplein. Location is perfect right in the city center close to the trendy districts â€œde Pijpâ€� and â€œUtrechtsestraatâ€�. We were over well med by the astonishing interior and design of the hotel. We were pleased by the nice and friendly staf that gave us a warm welcome at the front desk. I have to say that all the staff (housekeeping, bar and front desk) in the hotel were very friendly and helpful to us. The room was very clean and tidy and also nice and trendy decorated. Most of all we enjoyed the extremely comfortable Auping bed! The only thing that was missing (for the time of the year, summer) in the room was air-conditioning or a ventilator, because it was so hot in the room that we could barely sleep. . The next morning we enjoyed a nice extensive breakfast in the lounge. We were entertained looking at the large see trough window , were the people of Amsterdam were walking around on the street in front of the hotel.. We really enjoyed our stay at hotel V Frediksplein, and hope to come back some time!

Reviews.Title: “Well Worth The Money”
Reviews.Author: WNTRAVELS
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 5 nights in August, very close to the city centre, you can catch a tram from outside the hotel to all areas. For a good night out head into Leidseplein on the number 7 tram or 10.... the pub the "Last Waterhole" is a great spot if you want to hear live bands & theres lots of different places to eat - Hotel V staff were very friendly and helpful, the room was very clean - only downfall was the stairs leading to it...... be prepared to climb - but for the time we spent here it was worth it, would definitely stay here again, you get what you pay for - well worth it, once it's clean & staff are nice that does it for me :)

Reviews.Title: “Would stay again”
Reviews.Author: paddymc67
Reviews.Content: During seveal visits to Amsterdam previously I have always tried to stay in and around the famous Red light Area. This is the first time we stayed at a hotel a "little farther out", but was indeed surprised to find it isn't far out at all, it was very central for all the main tourist areas, Leidesplien and Rembrandtsplien as well as only being 10min from Central Station by tram. The hotel it's self was very clean and modern and although the rooms were quite small they served the purpose perfectly for a three night stay. The buffet breakfast was presented well and was the perfect start to a long day of walking ahead. Hotel staff from the minute we arrived were warm and friendly, and any requests made of them was dealt with efficiently and always with a smile. The whole experience staying at V Hotel was very enjoyable and would be my first choice on my next trip to Amsterdam.

Reviews.Title: “Form over function - but great staff”
Reviews.Author: dyllll
Reviews.Content: I definitely agree with many of the other reviews that the rooms are too small, and there isn't enough storage. Theyâ€™ve crammed one too many rooms onto each floor and then concentrated on appearance over practicalities. We stayed for 3 nights in a standard double room. Everything looked very good, but the bed was cramped into an alcove and just a few inches from the wall - no good if you've got big feet. The storage was another alcove with a curtain, and luckily some hangers included. A free safe was a bonus. There were no shelves or drawers, although there would have been space in some of the odd corners in the room. If I stayed again I think I'd have to go for a Large or X-Large to have a bit more space. The bathroom looked great, but it was tiny. We had to move the plastic stool thing where the towels were left outside, otherwise you couldn't sit on the loo. One tiny shelf just about held a couple of toothbrushes. The only mirror was in the bathroom too, with no natural light (and not much unnatural either). On the positive side, the location was good - it isn't central but we knew that from the web site and it's good not to be in the red light district - there were plenty of bars and restaurants around, either heading towards the centre, or south into Pijp. One tram line outside and another just around the corner meant good transport links. Breakfast also great - better choice than I'd expected. Iâ€™d possibly stay again but in a larger room. I didnâ€™t feel it was particularly good value for money (but that was partly down to the plunging value of GBP).

Reviews.Title: “Costly but clean and cozy”
Reviews.Author: RomanticMykonos
Reviews.Content: Me and my wife had a few nights stay at Hotel V Frederiksplein. It is located in a lovely neighborhood not far but not close to the Dam (20-25 min walk). Museumplein is in short distance and there is tram stop just outside the hotel. Although we are fans of walking, we used the tram no.4 or no.15 from/to Centraal in the last days. Of course bicycle rules, so, go for renting one. We stayed in a standard double room, on the 1st floor of the side building. No elevator but this didn't bother us. Room was the smallest we have ever been. We loved its cozy decor. In the place of wardrobe there were three hangs for our clothes. Bathroom was small but practical, functioning, and of course pretty modern. There was also a small safe for our valuables. The small radiator struggled inefficiently to warm up the room. We enjoyed the peace and calmness of our room until a neighbour room was occupied. One night, we were bothered by the noise of the next door opening and closing. The slamming of the next door was so loud and clear that we thought that somebody was invading our room! For sure, this is also a matter of personal behaviour and respect for your neighbours, especially in early morning hours. Staff was so friendly as every Dutch people we met during our stay. It consisted of young guys and girls, trully kind, english speaking and willing to help with exploring Amsterdam. Breakfast was good, with a normal number of choices. The buffet was refreshed regularly and we never missed something. Thus, everymorning, we were filled with all the required energy to explore this fantastic city! We were very satisfied by the cleanliness in the room and the hotel. The strongest part of the hotel is the lobby area. Perfect for relaxing by the fire, having a drink and people-watching. It's worth mentioning the very good music playing through the lobby's speakers. In general, we enjoyed our visit to this modern concept hotel that had been recently renovated. We enjoyed it because we were not looking for something typical or luxury. We would be coming back if we could have a better deal than the 159 Euros we payed per night (not including 5% tax). We think a better price would be around 100-110 Euros for a standard double (including taxes). Fortunately, the visit in wonderful Amsterdam repayed us a lot!

Reviews.Title: “Skip it”
Reviews.Author: americaninstockholm
Reviews.Content: Nice try at design, but incredibly unpractical. LOTS of sharp edges in the rooms. Very THIN walls. The doors in the hallways are always slamming. Average breakfast. Nice staff. GREAT beds. CLEAN room. Unfortunately, this place is overpriced for what you get. Wow... how can the doors slam so hard? Is this the 90th time since 06.30??? No need for an alarm clock

Reviews.Title: “miles away and tiny.com!”
Reviews.Author: salalpha
Reviews.Content: This was booked thru a friend of a Hen party I went with. I have stayed in Amsterdam six times before and for ease (and less expense) try to stay as near to central station as possible! The problems started when our cab drivers didnt know where they were going, however the hotel being fairly new it was prob expected! There was 10 people in the party and two cabs cost us 40Euro. Upon entering the Hotel you are blown away by the modern way the decor is and how welcoming and friendly it looked! I was more than pleased even if I didnt have a clue where we were based! We got our 5 sets of keys and just picked them from the table randomly, the guy on reception didnt advise us as to how to get to our room and we had a bit of a run around looking for it...The lift struggles to fit 2 people over size 16 in it with luggage (alot of hilarity though for us still at this point!!). I was sharing with my gay friend and requested a twin room, we asked were it was and we were shown a seperate building down a ramp at the back of the main entrance area! The Bed appeared to be a small double but we soon discovered was 2 (small) singles pushed together. To emphasize the size of the rooms all i can say is if you are built like Kylie and staying in a double on your own you will be fine!!!! Absolutely beautiful decor but nowhere to put our cases, no mirror, no dressing table or drawers, the wardrobe was a recess in the wall with no hangers or shelves in it and a white curtain! The bathroom was even worse! There was a black plastic stool with 4 (equally small) towels and a hairdryer (the only normal sized thing in the place!!)placed on it, this prevented you being able to sit on the toilet! Once we had reasssembled our room so we could actually fit in it, going to the Loo still proved a chore asyou had to slide your legs under the sink to sit on it!!the shelf over the sink (presumably for your toileteries) was about 3 inch deep by 12 inch long! Just about held our toothbrushes and toothpaste!. The shower was really funky and based on a wetroom feel, again tiny and inappropriate as no door, so the whole bathroom got soaked (and anything you took in there too, which wud have to sit on the toilet seat!Yuk!) The windows were long sash ones and had black out blinds to pull down, if you didnt totally pull these down people checking in and having breaki could see you in bed! The blinds also let bright daylight in the sides defeating the object of them! The ramp outside the room was like decking and was on two long levels, you can imagine the noise from people arriving with cases, coming home after night out and staff back and too with trolleys of rubbish and laundry! Back to first night, we asked the lovely guy at reception how far we were from red light district, he told us approx 40min walk?!?!?The trams 25 and 7 stop outside but finish at 12.30am. We wanted water for our room and with it being midnight the bar was shut, we asked were we could get some refreshments (always available in red light area and surrounding) He looked quite perplexed as he told us it was 3 tram stops away?! And then he didnt know if it would be open!!! Two of the ladies with us were the Hens mother and Auntie and their room was a single (three quarter bed!) it was in the basement with tiny box windows atthe top of the walls and was even smaller than ours!! These ladies are touching 60 and were told in no uncertain terms that their rooms could not be changed (no apology!) They ended up topping and tailing!!! (bloody good job me and Christopher didnt end up in 007!!) The stairs everywere are extremely steep and usually spiral with no handrails. Second night we got back approx 10.30 and asked about any snacks, we were offered a choice of prepacked anchovy sarni, chorizo sarni or stilton pear and veg (??!!??) sarni! No ta! Ill eat most with the best of em but made do with a mini box of pringles!. Breakfast room was in the foyer on iron chairs and you have guessed it, tiny tables! Beautiful continental though and staff so lovely. I think this hotel has early teething probs and maybe should have concentrated on space rather than cowskin hide and pebbles, its extremely overpriced for the size of it and the location ( 104 shiny pounds per night!) maybe half ofthat price would be more suitable based on other hotels. Have stayed in all sorts from hostels to 5 star in The Dam but this is the first time I have felt compelled to write in! We made the most of it and came home shuntin sideways like crabs but would reccomend you to find somewhere nearer to town and bigger (unless your a size zero!!) will maybe laugh about it in a few week!!

Reviews.Title: “Quirky and unique hotel, had a great stay”
Reviews.Author: InkwotaBeru
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a 3 night stay at the V in Frederiksplein. I agree with InspectorBaggaley's review below. The hotel is well designed and quirky, with high quality finishes and fittings. It has some idiosyncrasies, but the great atmosphere and the friendly staff make you forget them. We really felt at home there and often hung out in the lobby by the fire, watching the world go by (the hotel faces a cafe/bar, a tram stop, and an ATM so is perfect for people-watching :) or using the free Internet terminals. Check out the hotel's website for a sample of the type of music that is always playing in the lobby. The hotel is about 10 mins by tram (No. 4 or 25) from the Centraal Station and the tram stops right in front of the property. Worth noting that the rooms come in Small, Standard, Large, and X Large; we stayed in an X Large room and it was reasonably-sized, although certainly not huge. It was snowing outside but with the radiator on full it was 20-21 degrees in the room, so not too bad, although it did feel chilly sometimes. Beds were fantastic. The buffet (continental) breakfast was of a good standard but worth arriving by 9am if you want the full choice, otherwise stocks of cheese and fruit tended to be running a bit low. The bathroom was cramped and no bath but had a gorgeous rain shower. The elevator is indeed tiny and only fit one person plus suitcase or two people without, but it's cute with its hairy tiles! Also the room numbers and the elevator floor numbers don't match - you push button "0" for the gound floor and "1" for the next floor up, but confusingly all the rooms on this floor "1" are numbered 200-something! Half-way through our stay the light in the elevator broke so it was then pitch dark inside, which was another unique experience! However, despite these quirks/teething troubles, we really enjoyed our stay and would definitely return to the V. If you're looking for a taste of Dutch design away from the craziness of the red light district/centre but within easy reach of the sights, we would definitely recommend this place!

Reviews.Title: “Cramped and Cold Rooms”
Reviews.Author: NZChef
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the hotel when it had just opened and advertised being a four star design hotel, so we expected a funcky design, cool new clean rooms and nice bed. The floors in the room were black looked well worn and so cold, my partner hardly feels the cold and could not walk on the floors in bare feet. The rooms were so tiny, there was no desk or table to put bags or anything ion in fact, you could not even walk around the sides of the bed. No draws or any space to hang or put clothes and jackets. No robes or Slippers or toiletries (except soap) on offer. In the bathroom we had to put the toilet seat down to have somewere to place our towels and toiletries while we showered, It fell below the ranks of a cramped and tiny room. Lift could only fit one person at a time and the hallways were all black, showing every mark and looking worn already. Staff were friendly.

Reviews.Title: “So So...”
Reviews.Author: LondonPerez
Reviews.Content: Very trendy looking & modern but I was a little disappointed. The hotel is quite a way from the city centre, it took us about 20 mins to walk to Dam Square. I recommend taking the tram, number 25 goes from Centraal Station to right outside the hotel and runs about every 15 mins. The staff were relatively pleasant, however my requests for an iron went unanswered and the room was only cleaned once in our 3 night stay. The 'breakfast' consists of bread, ham, cheese, jam, cold eggs and some mini pastries. All in all I would say that there are other three star hotels in Amsterdam that would provide a much better base for exploring the city.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, cool, Dutch design at an affordable design, with a great location.”
Reviews.Author: GlobalDavidG
Reviews.Content: Pretty good balance of design and value located within easy walking distance to Rembrandtplein. Rooms are typical Dutch small, but very well designed with a cozy lobby area for gathering with friends in front of the mod fire pit and comfy sofa. If you like cool, clean design, you'll like it here.

HotelInfo.Name: Hotel V Frederiksplein
HotelInfo.Address: Weteringschans 136, Amsterdam 1017 XV , The Netherlands
